Paragraph.Text: a competent authority has conducted or approved a home study of the adoptive parents;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: before the adoption, the child’s parents gave their free and informed consent to the child’s adoption;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the adoption created a genuine parent-child relationship;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the adoption was in accordance with the laws of the place where the adoption took place;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the adoption was in accordance with the laws of the sponsor’s place of residence and, if the sponsor resided in Canada at the time the adoption took place, the competent authority of the child’s province of intended destination has stated in writing that it does not object to the adoption;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the adoption is an international adoption and the country in which the adoption took place and the child’s province of intended destination are parties to the Hague Convention on Adoption, the competent authority of the country and of the province have stated in writing that they approve the adoption as conforming to that Convention; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the adoption is an international adoption and either the country in which the adoption took place or the child’s province of intended destination is not a party to the Hague Convention on Adoption, there is no evidence that the adoption is for the purpose of child trafficking or undue gain within the meaning of that Convention.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national who is the adopted child of a sponsor and whose adoption took place when the child was 18 years of age or older shall not be considered a member of the family class by virtue of that adoption unless it took place under the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the adoption was in accordance with the laws of the place where the adoption took place and, if the sponsor resided in Canada at the time of the adoption, the adoption was in accordance with the laws of the province where the sponsor then resided, if any, that applied in respect of the adoption of a child 18 years of age or older;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a genuine parent-child relationship existed at the time of the adoption and existed before the child reached the age of 18; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the adoption was not entered into primarily for the purpose of acquiring any status or privilege under the Act.

Subsection.Text: If a statement referred to in clause (1)(g)(iii)(B) or paragraph (3)(e) or (f) has been provided to an officer by the competent authority of the foreign national’s province of intended destination, that statement is, except in the case of an adoption that was entered into primarily for the purpose of acquiring any status or privilege under the Act, conclusive evidence that the foreign national meets the following applicable requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person referred to in paragraph (1)(g), the requirements set out in clause (1)(g)(iii)(A); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person referred to in paragraph (1)(b) who is an adopted child described in subsection (2), the requirements set out in paragraphs (3)(a) to (e) and (g).

Subsection.Text: If, after the statement is provided to the officer, the officer receives evidence that the foreign national does not meet the applicable requirements set out in paragraph (7)(b) or (c) for becoming a member of the family class, the processing of their application shall be suspended until the officer provides that evidence to the competent authority of the province and that authority confirms or revises its statement.
A foreign national shall not be considered a member of the family class by virtue of their relationship to a sponsor if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner and is under 18 years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner, the sponsor has an existing sponsorship undertaking in respect of a spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner and the period referred to in subsection 132(1) in respect of that undertaking has not ended;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the sponsor or the foreign national was, at the time of their marriage, the spouse of another person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the sponsor has lived separate and apart from the foreign national for at least one year and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the sponsor is the common-law partner of another person or the sponsor has a conjugal partner, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the foreign national is the common-law partner of another person or the conjugal partner of another sponsor; or

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse and if at the time the marriage ceremony was conducted either one or both of the spouses were not physically present unless the foreign national was marrying a person who was not physically present at the ceremony as a result of their service as a member of the Canadian Forces and the marriage is valid both under the laws of the jurisdiction where it took place and under Canadian law;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (10), the sponsor previously made an application for permanent residence and became a permanent resident and, at the time of that application, the foreign national was a non-accompanying family member of the sponsor and was not examined.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (11), paragraph (9)(d) does not apply in respect of a foreign national referred to in that paragraph who was not examined because an officer determined that they were not required by the Act or the former Act, as applicable, to be examined.
Paragraph (9)(d) applies in respect of a foreign national referred to in subsection (10) if an officer determines that, at the time of the application referred to in that paragraph,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor was informed that the foreign national could be examined and the sponsor was able to make the foreign national available for examination but did not do so or the foreign national did not appear for examination; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national was the sponsor’s spouse, was living separate and apart from the sponsor and was not examined.

Subsection.Text: In subsection (10), former Act has the same meaning as in section 187 of the Act.

Section.Text: A foreign national who is an adopted dependent child or is a person referred to in paragraph 117(1)(f) or (g) shall not be issued a permanent resident visa as a member of the family class unless the sponsor has provided a statement in writing confirming that they have obtained information about the medical condition of the child or of the foreign national.
A decision shall not be made on an application for a permanent resident visa by a member of the family class if the sponsor withdraws their sponsorship application in respect of that member.
For the purposes of Part 5,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a permanent resident visa shall not be issued to a foreign national who makes an application as a member of the family class or to their accompanying family members unless a sponsorship undertaking in respect of the foreign national and those family members is in effect; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who makes an application as a member of the family class and their accompanying family members shall not become permanent residents unless a sponsorship undertaking in respect of the foreign national and those family members is in effect and the sponsor who gave that undertaking still meets the requirements of section 133 and, if applicable, section 137.

Section.Text: Subject to subsection 25.1(1), a person who is a member of the family class or a family member of a member of the family class who makes an application under Division 6 of Part 5 must be a family member of the applicant or of the sponsor both at the time the application is made and at the time of the determination of the application.

A foreign national who is an accompanying family member of a person who makes an application as a member of the family class shall become a permanent resident if, following an examination, it is established that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person who made the application has become a permanent resident; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the family member is not inadmissible.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 2
Heading.TitleText: Spouse or Common-Law Partner in Canada Class

Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 12(1) of the Act, the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class is hereby prescribed as a class of persons who may become permanent residents on the basis of the requirements of this Division.
A foreign national is a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are the spouse or common-law partner of a sponsor and cohabit with that sponsor in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have temporary resident status in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are the subject of a sponsorship application.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national shall not be considered a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class by virtue of their relationship to the sponsor if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse or common-law partner and is under 18 years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse or common-law partner, the sponsor has an existing sponsorship undertaking in respect of a spouse or common-law partner and the period referred to in subsection 132(1) in respect of that undertaking has not ended;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the sponsor or the spouse was, at the time of their marriage, the spouse of another person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the sponsor has lived separate and apart from the foreign national for at least one year and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the sponsor is the common-law partner of another person or the sponsor has a conjugal partner, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the foreign national is the common-law partner of another person or the conjugal partner of another sponsor;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse and if at the time the marriage ceremony was conducted either one or both of the spouses were not physically present unless the foreign national was married to a person who was not physically present at the ceremony as a result of their service as a member of the Canadian Forces and the marriage is valid both under the laws of the jurisdiction where it took place and under Canadian law; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), the sponsor previously made an application for permanent residence and became a permanent resident and, at the time of that application, the foreign national was a non-accompanying family member of the sponsor and was not examined.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), paragraph (1)(d) does not apply in respect of a foreign national referred to in that paragraph who was not examined because an officer determined that they were not required by the Act or the former Act, as applicable, to be examined.
Paragraph (1)(d) applies in respect of a foreign national referred to in subsection (2) if an officer determines that, at the time of the application referred to in that paragraph,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor was informed that the foreign national could be examined and the sponsor was able to make the foreign national available for examination but did not do so or the foreign national did not appear for examination; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national was the sponsor’s spouse, was living separate and apart from the sponsor and was not examined.

Subsection.Text: In subsection (2), former Act has the same meaning as in section 187 of the Act.

Section.Text: A decision shall not be made on an application for permanent residence by a foreign national as a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class if the sponsor withdraws their sponsorship application in respect of that foreign national.

For the purposes of Part 5, a foreign national who makes an application as a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class and their accompanying family members shall not become a permanent resident unless a sponsorship undertaking in respect of the foreign national and those family members is in effect and the sponsor who gave that undertaking still meets the requirements of section 133 and, if applicable, section 137.
The requirements with respect to a person who is a family member of a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class who makes an application under Division 6 of Part 5 are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection 25.1(1), the person is a family member of the applicant both at the time the application is made and at the time of the determination of the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at the time it is made, the application includes a request for the family member to remain in Canada as a permanent resident.

Section.Text: A foreign national who is an accompanying family member of a person who makes an application as a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class shall become a permanent resident if, following an examination, it is established that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person who made the application has become a permanent resident; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the family member is not inadmissible.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a sponsor, for the purpose of sponsoring a foreign national who makes an application for a permanent resident visa as a member of the family class or an application to remain in Canada as a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class under subsection 13(1) of the Act, must be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is at least 18 years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: resides in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has filed a sponsorship application in respect of a member of the family class or the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class in accordance with section 10.

Subsection.Text: A sponsor who is a Canadian citizen and does not reside in Canada may sponsor a foreign national who makes an application referred to in subsection (1) and is the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner, conjugal partner or dependent child who has no dependent children, if the sponsor will reside in Canada when the foreign national becomes a permanent resident.

A sponsor who became a permanent resident or a Canadian citizen after being sponsored as a spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner under subsection 13(1) of the Act may not sponsor a foreign national referred to in subsection (1) as a spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner, unless the sponsor has been a permanent resident, or a Canadian citizen, or a combination of the two, for a period of at least five years immediately preceding the day on which a sponsorship application referred to in paragraph (1)(c) is filed by the sponsor in respect of the foreign national.

Section.Text: The sponsor’s undertaking shall be given

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the sponsor resides in a province that has entered into an agreement referred to in subsection 8(1) of the Act that enables the province to determine and apply financial criteria with respect to sponsorship undertakings and to administer sponsorship undertakings, to the competent authority of the province.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the sponsor’s undertaking obliges the sponsor to reimburse Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province for every benefit provided as social assistance to or on behalf of the sponsored foreign national and their family members during the period

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: beginning

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the foreign national enters Canada with a temporary resident permit, on the day of that entry,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the foreign national is in Canada, on the day on which the foreign national obtains a temporary resident permit following an application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, on the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ending

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the foreign national is the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner, on the last day of the period of three years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the foreign national is a dependent child of the sponsor or of the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner, or is a person referred to in paragraph 117(1)(g), and is less than 22 years of age on the day on which he or she becomes a permanent resident, on the earlier of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the last day of the period of 10 years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the day on which the foreign national attains 25 years of age,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the foreign national is a dependent child of the sponsor or of the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner and is 22 years of age or older on the day on which he or she becomes a permanent resident, on the last day of the period of three years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: on the last day of the period of 20 years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident, if the foreign national is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the sponsor’s mother or father,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the mother or father of the sponsor’s mother or father, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: an accompanying family member of the foreign national described in clause (A) or (B), and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if the foreign national is a person other than a person referred to in subparagraph (i), (ii), (iii) or (iv), on the last day of the period of 10 years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an undertaking to a competent authority of a province referred to in paragraph 131(b), the period referred to in subsection (1) shall end not later than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the foreign national is a sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner, on the last day of the period of three years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the foreign national is a dependent child of the sponsor or of the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner, or is a person referred to in paragraph 117(1)(g), and is less than 22 years of age on the day on which he or she becomes a permanent resident, the later of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the foreign national attains 22 years of age, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the last day of the period of 10 years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the foreign national is a dependent child of the sponsor or of the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner and is 22 years of age or older on the day on which he or she becomes a permanent resident, on the last day of the period of 10 years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: on the last day of the period of 20 years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident, if the foreign national is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the sponsor’s mother or father,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the mother or father of the sponsor’s mother or father, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an accompanying family member of the foreign national described in subparagraph (i) or (ii); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the foreign national is a person other than a person referred to in paragraphs (a) to (d), on the last day of the period of 10 years following the day on which the foreign national becomes a permanent resident.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), the period referred to in subsection (1) shall end not later than the day provided for by the laws of the province if that day is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national referred to in paragraph (2)(a), earlier than the last day referred to in that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national referred to in paragraph (2)(b), earlier than the later of the days referred to in subparagraph (2)(b)(i) and (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national referred to in paragraph (2)(c), earlier than the last day referred to in that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national referred to in paragraph (2)(d), earlier than the last day referred to in that paragraph; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national referred to in paragraph (2)(e), earlier than the last day referred to in that paragraph.

Subsection.Text: Subject to paragraph 137(c), if the person is to be sponsored as a member of the family class or of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class and is 22 years of age or older, or is less than 22 years of age and is the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner, the sponsor, the co-signer, if any, and the person must, before the sponsorship application is approved, enter into a written agreement that includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement by the sponsor and the co-signer, if any, that they will provide for the basic requirements of the person and their accompanying family members during the applicable period referred to in subsection (1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration by the sponsor and the co-signer, if any, that their financial obligations do not prevent them from honouring their agreement with the person and their undertaking to the Minister in respect of the person’s application; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement by the person that they will make every reasonable effort to provide for their own basic requirements as well as those of their accompanying family members.

Subsection.Text: Subject to paragraph 137(c), the sponsor’s undertaking may be co-signed by the spouse or common-law partner of the sponsor if the spouse or common-law partner meets the requirements set out in subsection 130(1), except paragraph 130(1)(c), and those set out in subsection 133(1), except paragraph 133(1)(a), and, in that case,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor’s income shall be calculated in accordance with paragraph 134(1)(b) or (c) or (1.1)(b), as applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the co-signing spouse or common-law partner is jointly and severally or solidarily bound with the sponsor to perform the obligations in the undertaking and is jointly and severally or solidarily liable with the sponsor for any breach of those obligations.

Subsection.Text: A sponsorship application shall only be approved by an officer if, on the day on which the application was filed and from that day until the day a decision is made with respect to the application, there is evidence that the sponsor

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is a sponsor as described in section 130;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: intends to fulfil the obligations in the sponsorship undertaking;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is not subject to a removal order;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is not detained in any penitentiary, jail, reformatory or prison;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has not been convicted under the Criminal Code of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence of a sexual nature, or an attempt or a threat to commit such an offence, against any person,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.1)
Subparagraph.Text: an indictable offence involving the use of violence and punishable by a maximum term of imprisonment of at least 10 years, or an attempt to commit such an offence, against any person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence that results in bodily harm, as defined in section 2 of the Criminal Code, to any of the following persons or an attempt or a threat to commit such an offence against any of the following persons:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a current or former family member of the sponsor,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a relative of the sponsor, as well as a current or former family member of that relative,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a relative of the family member of the sponsor, or a current or former family member of that relative,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: a current or former conjugal partner of the sponsor,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: a current or former family member of a family member or conjugal partner of the sponsor,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: a relative of the conjugal partner of the sponsor, or a current or former family member of that relative,

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: a child under the current or former care and control of the sponsor, their current or former family member or conjugal partner,

Clause.Label: (H)
Clause.Text: a child under the current or former care and control of a relative of the sponsor or a current or former family member of that relative, or

Clause.Label: (I)
Clause.Text: someone the sponsor is dating or has dated, whether or not they have lived together, or a family member of that person;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: has not been convicted outside Canada of an offence that, if committed in Canada, would constitute an offence referred to in paragraph (e);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: subject to paragraph 137(c), is not in default of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any sponsorship undertaking, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any support payment obligations ordered by a court;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: is not in default in respect of the repayment of any debt referred to in subsection 145(1) of the Act payable to Her Majesty in right of Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subject to paragraph 137(c), is not an undischarged bankrupt under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: if the sponsor resides

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in a province other than a province referred to in paragraph 131(b),

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: has a total income that is at least equal to the minimum necessary income, if the sponsorship application was filed in respect of a foreign national other than a foreign national referred to in clause (B), or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: has a total income that is at least equal to the minimum necessary income, plus 30%, for each of the three consecutive taxation years immediately preceding the date of filing of the sponsorship application, if the sponsorship application was filed in respect of a foreign national who is

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: the mother or father of the sponsor’s mother or father, or

Subclause.Label: (III)
Subclause.Text: an accompanying family member of the foreign national described in subclause (I) or (II), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a province referred to in paragraph 131(b), is able, within the meaning of the laws of that province and as determined by the competent authority of that province, to fulfil the undertaking referred to in that paragraph; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: is not in receipt of social assistance for a reason other than disability.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(e), a sponsorship application may not be refused

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the basis of a conviction in Canada in respect of which a pardon has been granted and has not ceased to have effect or been revoked under the Criminal Records Act, or in respect of which there has been a final determination of an acquittal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if a period of five years or more has elapsed since the completion of the sentence imposed for an offence in Canada referred to in paragraph (1)(e).

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(f), a sponsorship application may not be refused

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the basis of a conviction outside Canada in respect of which there has been a final determination of an acquittal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if a period of five years or more has elapsed since the completion of the sentence imposed for an offence outside Canada referred to in that paragraph and the sponsor has demonstrated that they have been rehabilitated.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(j) does not apply if the sponsored person is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner and has no dependent children;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner and has a dependent child who has no dependent children; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a dependent child of the sponsor who has no dependent children or a person referred to in paragraph 117(1)(g).

Subsection.Text: A person who is adopted outside Canada and whose adoption is subsequently revoked by a foreign authority or by a court in Canada of competent jurisdiction may sponsor an application for a permanent resident visa that is made by a member of the family class only if the revocation of the adoption was not obtained for the purpose of sponsoring that application.
Subject to subsection (3), for the purpose of clause 133(1)(j)(i)(A), the sponsor’s total income shall be calculated in accordance with the following rules:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor’s income shall be calculated on the basis of the last notice of assessment, or an equivalent document, issued by the Minister of National Revenue in respect of the most recent taxation year preceding the date of filing of the sponsorship application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the sponsor produces a document referred to in paragraph (a), the sponsor’s income is the income earned as reported in that document less the amounts referred to in subparagraphs (c)(i) to (v);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the sponsor does not produce a document referred to in paragraph (a), or if the sponsor’s income as calculated under paragraph (b) is less than their minimum necessary income, the sponsor’s Canadian income for the 12-month period preceding the date of filing of the sponsorship application is the income earned by the sponsor not including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any provincial allowance received by the sponsor for a program of instruction or training,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any social assistance received by the sponsor from a province,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any financial assistance received by the sponsor from the Government of Canada under a resettlement assistance program,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any amounts paid to the sponsor under the Employment Insurance Act, other than special benefits,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any monthly guaranteed income supplement paid to the sponsor under the Old Age Security Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: any Canada child benefit paid to the sponsor under the Income Tax Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if there is a co-signer, the income of the co-signer, as calculated in accordance with paragraphs (a) to (c), with any modifications that the circumstances require, shall be included in the calculation of the sponsor’s income.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), for the purpose of clause 133(1)(j)(i)(B), the sponsor’s total income shall be calculated in accordance with the following rules:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor’s income shall be calculated on the basis of the income earned as reported in the notices of assessment, or an equivalent document, issued by the Minister of National Revenue in respect of each of the three consecutive taxation years immediately preceding the date of filing of the sponsorship application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor’s income is the income earned as reported in the documents referred to in paragraph (a), not including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any provincial allowance received by the sponsor for a program of instruction or training,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any social assistance received by the sponsor from a province,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any financial assistance received by the sponsor from the Government of Canada under a resettlement assistance program,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any amounts paid to the sponsor under the Employment Insurance Act, other than special benefits,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any monthly guaranteed income supplement paid to the sponsor under the Old Age Security Act, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: any Canada child benefit paid to the sponsor under the Income Tax Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if there is a co-signer, the income of the co-signer, as calculated in accordance with paragraphs (a) and (b), with any modifications that the circumstances require, shall be included in the calculation of the sponsor’s income.

Subsection.Text: An officer may request from the sponsor, after the receipt of the sponsorship application but before a decision is made on an application for permanent residence, updated evidence of income if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the officer receives information indicating that the sponsor is no longer able to fulfil the obligations of the sponsorship undertaking; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than 12 months have elapsed since the receipt of the sponsorship application.

Subsection.Text: When an officer receives the updated evidence of income requested under subsection (2), the sponsor’s total income shall be calculated in accordance with subsection (1) or (1.1), as applicable, except that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of paragraph (1)(a), the sponsor’s income shall be calculated on the basis of the last notice of assessment, or an equivalent document, issued by the Minister of National Revenue in respect of the most recent taxation year preceding the day on which the officer receives the updated evidence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of paragraph (1)(c), the sponsor’s income is the sponsor’s Canadian income earned during the 12-month period preceding the day on which the officer receives the updated evidence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of paragraph (1.1)(a), the sponsor’s income shall be calculated on the basis of the income earned as reported in the notices of assessment, or an equivalent document, issued by the Minister of National Revenue in respect of each of the three consecutive taxation years immediately preceding the day on which the officer receives the updated evidence.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subparagraph 133(1)(g)(i), the default of a sponsorship undertaking

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: begins when

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a government makes a payment that the sponsor has in the undertaking promised to repay, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an obligation set out in the undertaking is breached; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ends, as the case may be, when

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the sponsor reimburses the government concerned, in full or in accordance with an agreement with that government, for amounts paid by it, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the sponsor ceases to be in breach of the obligation set out in the undertaking.

Section.MarginalNote: Suspension during proceedings against sponsor or co-signer

Subsection.Text: If any of the following proceedings are brought against a sponsor or co-signer, the sponsorship application shall not be processed until there has been a final determination of the proceeding:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the revocation of citizenship under the Citizenship Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a report prepared under subsection 44(1) of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a charge alleging the commission of an offence under an Act of Parliament punishable by a maximum term of imprisonment of at least 10 years.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Suspension during appeal by sponsor or co-signer
Subsection.Text: If a sponsor or co-signer has made an appeal under subsection 63(4) of the Act, the sponsorship application shall not be processed until the period for making the appeal has expired or there has been a final determination of the appeal.

Section.Text: If the sponsor resides in the Province of Quebec, the government of which has entered into an agreement referred to in paragraph 131(b),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor’s undertaking, given in accordance with section 131, is the undertaking required by An Act respecting immigration to Québec, R.S.Q., c.I-0.2, as amended from time to time;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an officer shall approve the sponsorship application only if there is evidence that the competent authority of the Province has determined that the sponsor, on the day the undertaking was given as well as on the day a decision was made with respect to the application, was able to fulfil the undertaking; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsections 132(4) and (5) and paragraphs 133(1)(g) and (i) do not apply.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may collect the social insurance numbers of a sponsor and a co-signer who have submitted an application to sponsor a person set out in clause 133(1)(j)(i)(B), in order to verify that they meet the requirements set out in clause 133(1)(j)(i)(B) and in paragraph 133(1)(k).

The Minister may disclose the social insurance numbers of the sponsor and the co-signer to the Canada Revenue Agency for the purposes set out in subsection (1) if the Minister has entered into an arrangement with the Agency for the disclosure of that information.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 1
Heading.TitleText: Convention Refugees Abroad, Humanitarian-protected Persons Abroad and Protected Temporary Residents

Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in this Division and in Division 2.

Definition.Text: group means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five or more Canadian citizens or permanent residents, each of whom is at least 18 years of age, who are acting together for the purpose of sponsoring a Convention refugee or a person in similar circumstances; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: one or more Canadian citizens or permanent residents, each of whom is at least 18 years of age, and a corporation or unincorporated organization or association referred to in subsection 13(2) of the Act, acting together for the purpose of sponsoring a Convention refugee or a person in similar circumstances.

Definition.Text: referral organization means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any organization with which the Minister has entered into a memorandum of understanding under section 143.

Definition.Text: sponsor means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a group, a corporation or an unincorporated organization or association referred to in subsection 13(2) of the Act, or any combination of them, that is acting for the purpose of sponsoring a Convention refugee or a person in similar circumstances; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the purposes of section 158, a sponsor within the meaning of the regulations made under An Act respecting immigration to Québec, R.S.Q., c.I-0.2, as amended from time to time.

Definition.Text: undertaking means an undertaking in writing to the Minister to provide resettlement assistance, lodging and other basic necessities in Canada for a member of a class prescribed by this Division, the member’s accompanying family members and any of the member’s non-accompanying family members who meet the requirements of section 141, for the period determined in accordance with subsections 154(2) and (3).

urgent need of protection means, in respect of a member of the Convention refugee abroad or the country of asylum class, that their life, liberty or physical safety is under immediate threat and, if not protected, the person is likely to be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: killed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subjected to violence, torture, sexual assault or arbitrary imprisonment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: returned to their country of nationality or of their former habitual residence.

Definition.Text: vulnerable means, in respect of a Convention refugee or a person in similar circumstances, that the person has a greater need of protection than other applicants for protection abroad because of the person’s particular circumstances that give rise to a heightened risk to their physical safety.

Subsection.Text: A permanent resident visa shall be issued to a foreign national in need of refugee protection, and their accompanying family members, if following an examination it is established that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is outside Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national has submitted an application for a permanent resident visa under this Division in accordance with paragraphs 10(1)(a) to (c) and (2)(c.1) to (d) and sections 140.1 to 140.3;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is seeking to come to Canada to establish permanent residence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is a person in respect of whom there is no reasonable prospect, within a reasonable period, of a durable solution in a country other than Canada, namely

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: voluntary repatriation or resettlement in their country of nationality or habitual residence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: resettlement or an offer of resettlement in another country;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is a member of one of the classes prescribed by this Division;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: one of the following is the case, namely

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the sponsor’s sponsorship application for the foreign national and their family members included in the application for protection has been approved under these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a member of the Convention refugee abroad class, financial assistance in the form of funds from a governmental resettlement assistance program is available in Canada for the foreign national and their family members included in the application for protection, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the foreign national has sufficient financial resources to provide for the lodging, care and maintenance, and for the resettlement in Canada, of themself and their family members included in the application for protection;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the foreign national intends to reside in a province other than the Province of Quebec, the foreign national and their family members included in the application for protection will be able to become successfully established in Canada, taking into account the following factors:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their resourcefulness and other similar qualities that assist in integration in a new society,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the presence of their relatives, including the relatives of a spouse or a common-law partner, or their sponsor in the expected community of resettlement,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: their potential for employment in Canada, given their education, work experience and skills, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: their ability to learn to communicate in one of the official languages of Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the foreign national intends to reside in the Province of Quebec, the competent authority of that Province is of the opinion that the foreign national and their family members included in the application for protection meet the selection criteria of the Province; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsections (3) and (4), the foreign national and their family members included in the application for protection are not inadmissible.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(g) does not apply to a foreign national, or their family members included in the application for protection, who has been determined by an officer to be vulnerable or in urgent need of protection.
A foreign national who is a member of a class prescribed by this Division, and meets the applicable requirements of this Division, is exempted from the application of section 39 of the Act.
A foreign national who is a member of a class prescribed by this Division, and meets the applicable requirements of this Division, is exempted from the application of paragraph 38(1)(c) of the Act.

Section.Text: Family members of an applicant who is determined to be a member of a class under this Division are members of the applicant’s class.

An application for a permanent resident visa submitted by a foreign national under this Division shall indicate that the foreign national is outside Canada and is making a claim for refugee protection and shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contain the name, address and country of birth of the applicant and of all their accompanying family members;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contain the name and country of birth of all the applicant’s non-accompanying family members; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: indicate whether the applicant or any of their accompanying or non-accompanying family members is the spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner of another person.

Section.MarginalNote: Sponsorship of foreign national — requirement to attach applications

Subsection.Text: If the foreign national making an application for a permanent resident visa under this Division is being sponsored, the application for a permanent resident visa shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be accompanied by a sponsorship application referred to in paragraph 153(1)(b) by which the foreign national is being sponsored; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be attached to the sponsorship application sent by the sponsor in accordance with subsection 153(1.2).

Subsection.Text: The foreign national who has chosen to have their application for a permanent resident visa accompanied by the sponsorship application shall send the application for a permanent resident visa and the sponsorship application to the Department’s Case Processing Centre in Canada for processing those applications.

If the foreign national making an application for a permanent resident visa under this Division is not being sponsored, a foreign national making an application for a permanent resident visa under this Division shall submit their application with one of the following referrals, if the referral has not yet been submitted to the immigration office by its issuer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a referral from a referral organization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a referral resulting from an arrangement between the Minister and the government of a foreign state or any institution of such a government relating to resettlement; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a referral resulting from an agreement relating to resettlement entered into by the Government of Canada and an international organization or the government of a foreign state.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national may submit the application without a referral if they reside in a geographic area as determined by the Minister in accordance with subsection (3).

The Minister may determine on the basis of the following factors that a geographic area is an area in which circumstances justify the submission of permanent resident visa applications without a referral:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: advice from referral organizations with which the Minister has entered into a memorandum of understanding under section 143 that they are unable to make the number of referrals specified in their memorandum of understanding for the area;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the inability of referral organizations to refer persons in the area;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the resettlement needs in the area, after consultation with referral organizations that have substantial knowledge of the area; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the relative importance of resettlement needs in the area, within the context of resettlement needs globally.

Subsection.Text: If the foreign national who is being referred under any of paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) or if the foreign national resides in a geographic area as determined by the Minister in accordance with subsection (3), the foreign national shall submit their application to the immigration office outside Canada that serves the foreign national’s place of residence.

Section.Text: An application for a permanent resident visa made under this Division, its related sponsorship application made under Division 2 of this Part and all documents submitted in support of the applications shall be returned to the person who sent the applications as a result of the choice made under subsection 140.2(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application for a permanent resident visa, the requirements set out in paragraph 139(1)(b) are not met; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a sponsorship application, the requirements set out in paragraph 153(1)(b) and subsections 153(1.2) and (2) are not met.

Subsection.Text: A permanent resident visa shall be issued to a family member who does not accompany the applicant if, following an examination, it is established that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the family member was included in the applicant’s permanent resident visa application at the time that application was made, or was added to that application before the applicant’s departure for Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the family member submits their application to an officer outside Canada within one year from the day on which refugee protection is conferred on the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the family member is not inadmissible;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is the subject of a sponsorship application referred to in paragraph 139(1)(f)(i), their sponsor has been notified of the family member’s application and an officer is satisfied that there are adequate financial arrangements for resettlement; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a family member who intends to reside in the Province of Quebec, the competent authority of that Province is of the opinion that the foreign national meets the selection criteria of the Province.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, the requirements set out in paragraph 139(1)(b) do not apply to the application of a non-accompanying family member.

Section.Text: Subject to subsections 25.1(1) and (6) to (8) and for the purposes of this Division, to be considered a family member of an applicant, a person must be a family member of the applicant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time the application referred to in paragraph 139(1)(b) is made; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at the time of the determination of the application referred to in paragraph 141(1)(b).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may enter into a memorandum of understanding with an organization for the purpose of locating and identifying Convention refugees and persons in similar circumstances if the organization demonstrates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a working knowledge of the provisions of the Act relating to protection criteria; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an ability abroad to locate and identify Convention refugees and persons in similar circumstances.

Subsection.Text: The memorandum of understanding shall include provisions with respect to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the geographic area to be served by the organization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of referrals that may be made by the organization and the manner of referral;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the training of members or employees of the organization; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the grounds for suspending or cancelling the memorandum of understanding.

Section.Text: The Convention refugees abroad class is prescribed as a class of persons who may be issued a permanent resident visa on the basis of the requirements of this Division.

Section.MarginalNote: Member of Convention refugees abroad class
Section.Text: A foreign national is a Convention refugee abroad and a member of the Convention refugees abroad class if the foreign national has been determined, outside Canada, by an officer to be a Convention refugee.

Section.MarginalNote: Person in similar circumstances to those of a Convention refugee

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 12(3) of the Act, a person in similar circumstances to those of a Convention refugee is a member of the country of asylum class.
The country of asylum class is prescribed as a humanitarian-protected persons abroad class of persons who may be issued permanent resident visas on the basis of the requirements of this Division.

Section.MarginalNote: Member of country of asylum class
Section.Text: A foreign national is a member of the country of asylum class if they have been determined by an officer to be in need of resettlement because

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they are outside all of their countries of nationality and habitual residence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they have been, and continue to be, seriously and personally affected by civil war, armed conflict or massive violation of human rights in each of those countries.

Section.Text: An officer shall issue a temporary travel document to a foreign national who has been determined to be a member of a class prescribed by this Division and who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: holds a permanent resident visa or a temporary resident permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not hold a valid passport or travel document issued by their country of nationality or the country of their present or former habitual residence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: does not hold a valid travel document issued by the United Nations or the International Committee of the Red Cross and is unable to obtain such a document within a reasonable time; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: would be unable to travel to Canada if the temporary travel document were not issued.

Subsection.Text: The protected temporary residents class is prescribed as a class of persons who may become permanent residents on the basis of the requirements of this section.
A foreign national is a protected temporary resident and a member of the protected temporary residents class if the foreign national holds a temporary resident permit and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: became a temporary resident under a temporary resident permit for protection reasons after making a claim for refugee protection outside Canada under section 99 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: was issued a Minister’s permit under section 37 of the former Act after seeking admission to Canada under section 7 of the former Regulations or section 4 of the Humanitarian Designated Classes Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national destined for Quebec does not become a member of the protected temporary residents class described in paragraph (2)(a) if they have not received a selection certificate from the Province of Quebec.

In subsection (2), former Act has the same meaning as in section 187 of the Act and former Regulations and Humanitarian Designated Classes Regulations have the same meaning as in subsection 316(1) of these Regulations.
The Minister may enter into a sponsorship agreement with a sponsor for the purpose of facilitating the processing of sponsorship applications.
A sponsorship agreement shall include provisions relating to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: settlement plans;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: financial requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: assistance to be provided by the Department;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the standard of conduct expected of the sponsor;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: reporting requirements; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the grounds for suspending or cancelling the agreement.

Subsection.Text: In order to sponsor a foreign national and their family members who are members of a class prescribed by Division 1, a sponsor

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must reside or have representatives in the expected community of settlement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: must make a sponsorship application that includes a settlement plan, an undertaking and, if the sponsor has not entered into a sponsorship agreement with the Minister, a document issued by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees or a foreign state certifying the status of the foreign national as a refugee under the rules applicable to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees or the applicable laws of the foreign state, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: must not be — or include — an individual, a corporation or an unincorporated organization or association that was a party to a sponsorship in which they defaulted on an undertaking and remain in default.

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs 13(1)(a) and (b) do not apply to the document referred to in paragraph (1)(b) issued by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees or a foreign state.

If the foreign national has chosen to have their application for a permanent resident visa attached to the sponsorship application in accordance with paragraph 140.2(1)(b), the sponsor must send the sponsorship application and the application for a permanent resident visa to the Department’s Case Processing Centre in Canada for processing those applications.
The undertaking referred to in paragraph (1)(b) shall be signed by each party to the sponsorship.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Joint and several or solidary liability
Subsection.Text: All parties to the undertaking are jointly and severally or solidarily liable.
A party or a sponsor who defaults on an undertaking ceases to be in default

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a sponsor who defaults on a financial obligation, when the sponsor has reimbursed the government concerned, in full or in accordance with an agreement with that government, for amounts paid by the government;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a party, other than an organization or association, who defaults on a financial obligation, when the defaulting party has reimbursed any other party to the sponsorship, in full or in accordance with an agreement with that party, for amounts paid by that party;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a sponsor who defaults on a non-financial obligation, when the sponsor satisfies an officer that they are in compliance with the obligation; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an organization or association that was a party to a sponsorship and defaulted for any reason, when a period of five years has elapsed from the date of default.

Subsection.Text: An officer shall approve an application referred to in paragraph 153(1)(b) if, on the basis of the documentation submitted with the application, the officer determines that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has the financial resources to fulfil the settlement plan for the duration of the undertaking, unless subsection 157(1) applies; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has made adequate arrangements in anticipation of the arrival of the foreign national and their family members in the expected community of settlement.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), the duration of an undertaking is one year.
An officer may, on the basis of the assessment made under paragraph 139(1)(g), require that the duration of the undertaking be more than one year but not more than three years.

Section.Text: An officer shall revoke an approval given in respect of an application under section 154 if the officer determines that the sponsor no longer meets the requirements of paragraph 154(1)(a) or (b) or is ineligible under subsection 156(1).

Section.MarginalNote: Ineligibility to be a party to a sponsorship

Subsection.Text: The following persons are ineligible to be a party to a sponsorship:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has been convicted in Canada of the offence of murder or an offence set out in Schedule I or II to the Corrections and Conditional Release Act, regardless of whether it was prosecuted by indictment, if a period of five years has not elapsed since the completion of the person’s sentence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has been convicted of an offence outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would constitute an offence referred to in paragraph (a), if a period of five years has not elapsed since the completion of the person’s sentence imposed under a foreign law;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is in default of any support payment obligations ordered by a court;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is subject to a removal order;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is subject to a revocation proceeding under the Citizenship Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is detained in any penitentiary, jail, reformatory or prison.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (1)(a), a sponsorship application may not be refused on the basis of a conviction in respect of which a pardon has been granted and has not ceased to have effect or been revoked under the Criminal Records Act, or in respect of which there has been a final determination of an acquittal.

If an officer determines that special needs exist in respect of a member of a class prescribed by Division 1, the Department shall endeavour to identify a sponsor in order to make the financial assistance of the Government of Canada available for the purpose of sponsorship. A sponsor identified by the Department is exempt from the financial requirements of paragraph 154(1)(a).
In this section, special needs means that a person has greater need of settlement assistance than other applicants for protection abroad owing to personal circumstances, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a large number of family members;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: trauma resulting from violence or torture;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: medical disabilities; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effects of systemic discrimination.

Section.MarginalNote: Settlement in the Province of Quebec
Section.Text: If the foreign national and their family members intend to reside in the Province of Quebec, the sponsor must meet the requirements for sponsorship that are provided by regulations made under An Act respecting immigration to Québec, R.S.Q., c.I-0.2, as amended from time to time. In such a case, the requirements of this Division, other than section 156, do not apply.
For the purposes of subsections 100(1) and (3) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a working day does not include Saturdays or holidays;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a day that is not a working day is not included in the calculation of the three-day period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the three-day period begins from the day on which the claim is received.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and sections 159.2 to 159.7.

Definition.Text: Agreement means the Agreement dated December 5, 2002 between the Government of Canada and the Government of the United States of America for Cooperation in the Examination of Refugee Status Claims from Nationals of Third Countries.
claimant means a claimant referred to in paragraph 101(1)(e) of the Act.
designated country means a country designated by section 159.3.

family member, in respect of a claimant, means their spouse or common-law partner, their legal guardian, and any of the following persons, namely, their child, father, mother, brother, sister, grandfather, grandmother, grandchild, uncle, aunt, nephew or niece.

legal guardian, in respect of a claimant who has not attained the age of 18 years, means a person who has custody of the claimant or who is empowered to act on the claimant’s behalf by virtue of a court order or written agreement or by operation of law.
United States means the United States of America, but does not include Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam or any other United States of America possession or territory.

Section.Text: .Paragraph 101(1)(e) of the Act does not apply to a claimant who is a stateless person who comes directly or indirectly to Canada from a designated country that is their country of former habitual residence.

The United States is designated under paragraph 102(1)(a) of the Act as a country that complies with Article 33 of the Refugee Convention and Article 3 of the Convention Against Torture, and is a designated country for the purpose of the application of paragraph 101(1)(e) of the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application — ports of entry other than land ports of entry

Subsection.Text: Paragraph 101(1)(e) of the Act does not apply to a claimant who seeks to enter Canada at

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a location that is not a port of entry;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a port of entry that is a harbour port, including a ferry landing; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), a port of entry that is an airport.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph 101(1)(e) of the Act applies to a claimant who has been ordered removed from the United States and who seeks to enter Canada at a port of entry that is an airport while they are in transit through Canada from the United States in the course of the enforcement of that order.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application — claimants at land ports of entry
Section.Text: Paragraph 101(1)(e) of the Act does not apply if a claimant who seeks to enter Canada at a location other than one identified in paragraphs 159.4(1)(a) to (c) establishes, in accordance with subsection 100(4) of the Act, that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of the claimant is in Canada and is a Canadian citizen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of the claimant is in Canada and is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a protected person within the meaning of subsection 95(2) of the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a permanent resident under the Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person in favour of whom a removal order has been stayed in accordance with section 233;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of the claimant who has attained the age of 18 years is in Canada and has made a claim for refugee protection that has been referred to the Board for determination, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the claim has been withdrawn by the family member,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the claim has been abandonned by the family member,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the claim has been rejected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any pending proceedings or proceedings respecting the claim have been terminated under subsection 104(2) of the Act or any decision respecting the claim has been nullified under that subsection;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of the claimant who has attained the age of 18 years is in Canada and is the holder of a work permit or study permit other than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a work permit that was issued under paragraph 206(b) or that has become invalid as a result of the application of section 209, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a study permit that has become invalid as a result of the application of section 222;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the claimant is a person who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has not attained the age of 18 years and is not accompanied by their mother, father or legal guardian,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has neither a spouse nor a common-law partner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: has neither a mother or father nor a legal guardian in Canada or the United States;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the claimant is the holder of any of the following documents, excluding any document issued for the sole purpose of transit through Canada, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a permanent resident visa or a temporary resident visa referred to in section 6 and subsection 7(1), respectively,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a temporary resident permit issued under subsection 24(1) of the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a travel document referred to in subsection 31(3) of the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: refugee travel papers issued by the Minister, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a temporary travel document referred to in section 151;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the claimant is a person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: who may, under the Act or these Regulations, enter Canada without being required to hold a visa, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: who would, if the claimant were entering the United States, be required to hold a visa; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the claimant is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a foreign national who is seeking to re-enter Canada in circumstances where they have been refused entry to the United States without having a refugee claim adjudicated there, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a permanent resident who has been ordered removed from the United States and is being returned to Canada.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application — claimants at land ports of entry and in transit
Section.Text: Paragraph 101(1)(e) of the Act does not apply if a claimant establishes, in accordance with subsection 100(4) of the Act, that the claimant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is charged in the United States with, or has been convicted there of, an offence that is punishable with the death penalty in the United States; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is charged in a country other than the United States with, or has been convicted there of, an offence that is punishable with the death penalty in that country.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 101(1)(e) of the Act, the application of all or part of sections 159.1 to 159.6 and this section is discontinued, in accordance with subsections (2) to (6), if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of suspension of the Agreement setting out the period of suspension is publicized broadly in the various regions of Canada by the Minister via information media and on the website of the Department;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of renewal of the suspension of the Agreement setting out the period of renewal of suspension is published in accordance with subsection (6);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of suspension of a part of the Agreement is issued by the Government of Canada and the Government of the United States; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of termination of the Agreement is issued by the Government of Canada or the Government of the United States.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Paragraph (1)(a) — notice of suspension of Agreement
Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), if a notice of suspension of the Agreement is publicized under paragraph (1)(a), sections 159.2 to 159.6 are rendered inoperative for a period of up to three months that shall be set out in the notice, which period shall begin on the day after the day on which the notice is publicized.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Paragraph (1)(b) — notice of renewal of suspension of Agreement
Subsection.Text: If a notice of renewal of the suspension of the Agreement is published under paragraph (1)(b), sections 159.2 to 159.6 are rendered inoperative for the further period of up to three months set out in the notice.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Paragraph (1)(c) — suspension of part of Agreement
Subsection.Text: If a notice of suspension of part of the Agreement is issued under paragraph (1)(c), those provisions of these Regulations relating to the application of the Agreement that are referred to in the notice are rendered inoperative for a period that shall be set out in the notice. All other provisions of these Regulations continue to apply.
If a notice of termination of the Agreement is issued under paragraph (1)(d), sections 159.1 to 159.6 and this section cease to have effect on the day set out in the notice.

Any notice referred to in paragraph (1)(b), (c) or (d) shall be published in the Canada Gazette, Part I, not less than seven days before the day on which the renewal, suspension in part or termination provided for in the notice is effective.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 3.1
Heading.TitleText: Claim for Refugee Protection — Time Limits

Section.MarginalNote: Time limit — provision of documents and information to officer

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 99(3.1) of the Act, a person who makes a claim for refugee protection inside Canada other than at a port of entry must provide an officer with the documents and information referred to in that subsection not later than the day on which the officer determines the eligibility of their claim under subsection 100(1) of the Act.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Time limit — provision of documents and information to Refugee Protection Division
Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), for the purpose of subsection 100(4) of the Act, a person who makes a claim for refugee protection inside Canada at a port of entry must provide the Refugee Protection Division with the documents and information referred to in subsection 100(4) not later than 15 days after the day on which the claim is referred to that Division.

If the documents and information cannot be provided within the time limit set out in subsection (2), the Refugee Protection Division may, for reasons of fairness and natural justice, extend that time limit by the number of days that is necessary in the circumstances.
Subject to subsections (2) and (3), for the purpose of subsection 100(4.1) of the Act, the date fixed for the hearing before the Refugee Protection Division must be not later than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a claimant referred to in subsection 111.1(2) of the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 days after the day on which the claim is referred to the Refugee Protection Division, if the claim is made inside Canada other than at a port of entry, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 45 days after the day on which the claim is referred to the Refugee Protection Division, if the claim is made inside Canada at a port of entry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other claimant, 60 days after the day on which the claim is referred to the Refugee Protection Division, whether the claim is made inside Canada at a port of entry or inside Canada other than at a port of entry.

Subsection.Text: If the time limit set out in subparagraph (1)(a)(i) or (ii) or paragraph (1)(b) ends on a Saturday, that time limit is extended to the next working day.

If the hearing cannot be held within the time limit set out in subparagraph (1)(a)(i) or (ii) or paragraph (1)(b) for any of the following reasons, the hearing must be held as soon as feasible after that time limit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for reasons of fairness and natural justice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: because of a pending investigation or inquiry relating to any of sections 34 to 37 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: because of operational limitations of the Refugee Protection Division.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), for the purpose of subsection 110(2.1) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the time limit for a person or the Minister to file an appeal to the Refugee Appeal Division against a decision of the Refugee Protection Division is 15 days after the day on which the person or the Minister receives written reasons for the decision; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the time limit for a person or the Minister to perfect such an appeal is 30 days after the day on which the person or the Minister receives written reasons for the decision.

Subsection.Text: If the appeal cannot be filed within the time limit set out in paragraph 1)(a) or perfected within the time limit set out in paragraph (1)(b), the Refugee Appeal Division may, for reasons of fairness and natural justice, extend each of those time limits by the number of days that is necessary in the circumstances.

Subject to subsection (2), for the purpose of subsection 110(3.1) of the Act, except when a hearing is held under subsection 110(6) of the Act, the time limit for the Refugee Appeal Division to make a decision on an appeal is 90 days after the day on which the appeal is perfected.
