If it is not possible for the Refugee Appeal Division to make a decision on an appeal within the time limit set out in subsection (1), the decision must be made as soon as feasible after that time limit.
Subject to subsection (2) and for the purposes of subsection 112(1) of the Act, a person may apply for protection after they are given notification to that effect by the Department.
A person described in section 165 or 166 may apply for protection in accordance with that section without being given notification to that effect by the Department.
Notification shall be given

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person who is subject to a removal order that is in force, before removal from Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person named in a certificate described in subsection 77(1) of the Act, when the summary of information and other evidence is filed under subsection 77(2) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: Notification is given

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: when the person is given the application for protection form by hand; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the application for protection form is sent by mail, seven days after the day on which it was sent to the person at the last address provided by them to the Department.

Section.MarginalNote: Criterion — exemption from application of paragraphs 112(2)(b.1) or (c) of the Act
Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 112(2.1) of the Act, the Minister must consider, when an exemption is made, any event having arisen in a country that could place all or some of its nationals or former habitual residents referred to in that subsection in a situation similar to those referred to in section 96 or 97 of the Act for which a person may be determined to be a Convention refugee or a person in need of protection.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 166, a person applying for protection may make written submissions in support of their application and for that purpose may be assisted, at their own expense, by a barrister or solicitor or other counsel.
A person who makes written submissions must identify the evidence presented that meets the requirements of paragraph 113(a) of the Act and indicate how that evidence relates to them.

Section.Text: An application received within 15 days after notification was given under section 160 shall not be decided until at least 30 days after notification was given. The removal order is stayed under section 232 until the earliest of the events referred to in paragraphs 232(c) to (f) occurs.

A person who has remained in Canada since being given notification under section 160 may make an application after a period of 15 days has elapsed from notification being given under that section, but the application does not result in a stay of the removal order. Written submissions, if any, must accompany the application.

Section.MarginalNote: Application that must be received within 15-day period — certificate
Section.Text: Despite section 163, an application by a person who is named in a certificate described in subsection 77(1) of the Act must be received within 15 days after notification was given under section 160. An application received within that period shall not be decided until at least 30 days after notification was given.

A person whose application for protection was rejected and who has remained in Canada since being given notification under section 160 may make another application. Written submissions, if any, must accompany the application. For greater certainty, the application does not result in a stay of the removal order.

An application for protection by a foreign national against whom a removal order is made at a port of entry as a result of a determination of inadmissibility on entry into Canada must, if the order is in force, be received as soon as the removal order is made. Written submissions, if any, must accompany the application. For greater certainty, the application does not result in a stay of the removal order.
For the purpose of determining whether a hearing is required under paragraph 113(b) of the Act, the factors are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether there is evidence that raises a serious issue of the applicant’s credibility and is related to the factors set out in sections 96 and 97 of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether the evidence is central to the decision with respect to the application for protection; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whether the evidence, if accepted, would justify allowing the application for protection.

Section.Text: A hearing is subject to the following provisions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notice shall be provided to the applicant of the time and place of the hearing and the issues of fact that will be raised at the hearing;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the hearing is restricted to matters relating to the issues of fact stated in the notice, unless the officer conducting the hearing considers that other issues of fact have been raised by statements made by the applicant during the hearing;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant must respond to the questions posed by the officer and may be assisted for that purpose, at their own expense, by a barrister or solicitor or other counsel; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any evidence of a person other than the applicant must be in writing and the officer may question the person for the purpose of verifying the evidence provided.

Section.Text: An application for protection is declared abandoned

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an applicant who fails to appear at a hearing, if the applicant is given notice of a subsequent hearing and fails to appear at that hearing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an applicant who voluntarily departs Canada, when the applicant’s removal order is enforced under section 240 or the applicant otherwise departs Canada.

Section.Text: An application for protection may be withdrawn by the applicant at any time by notifying the Minister in writing. The application is declared to be withdrawn on receipt of the notice.
An application for protection is rejected when a decision is made not to allow the application or when the application is declared withdrawn or abandoned.

Section.MarginalNote: Applicant described in s. 112(3) of the Act

Subsection.Text: Before making a decision to allow or reject the application of an applicant described in subsection 112(3) of the Act, the Minister shall consider the assessments referred to in subsection (2) and any written response of the applicant to the assessments that is received within 15 days after the applicant is given the assessments.
The following assessments shall be given to the applicant:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a written assessment on the basis of the factors set out in section 97 of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a written assessment on the basis of the factors set out in subparagraph 113(d)(i) or (ii) of the Act, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), no assessments shall be given to an applicant who is named in a certificate until a judge under section 78 of the Act determines whether the certificate is reasonable.

The assessments are given to an applicant when they are given by hand to the applicant or, if sent by mail, are deemed to be given to an applicant seven days after the day on which they are sent to the last address that the applicant provided to the Department.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Applicant not described in s. 97 of the Act
Subsection.Text: Despite subsections (1) to (3), if the Minister decides on the basis of the factors set out in section 97 of the Act that the applicant is not described in that section,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no written assessment on the basis of the factors set out in subparagraph 113(d)(i) or (ii) of the Act need be made; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the application is rejected.

Subsection.Text: A person in respect of whom a stay of a removal order, with respect to a country or place, is being re-examined under subsection 114(2) of the Act shall be given

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of re-examination;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a written assessment on the basis of the factors set out in section 97 of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a written assessment on the basis of the factors set out in subparagraph 113(d)(i) or (ii) of the Act, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: Before making a decision to cancel or maintain the stay of the removal order, the Minister shall consider the assessments and any written response of the person in respect of whom the stay is being re-examined that is received within 15 days after the assessments are given to that person.

The assessments are given to an applicant when they are given by hand to the applicant or, if sent by mail, are deemed to be given to an applicant seven days after the day on which they are sent to the last address that the applicant provided to the Department.

Section.Text: On request, an applicant shall be given a copy of the file notes that record the justification for the decision on their application for protection.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 4.1
Heading.TitleText: Designated Foreign National — Requirement to Report to an Officer

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 98.1(1) of the Act, a designated foreign national referred to in that subsection who has not become a permanent resident under subsection 21(2) of the Act must report to an officer as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in person, not more than 30 days after refugee protection is conferred on the designated foreign national under paragraph 95(1)(b) or (c) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: once a year in each year after the day on which the foreign national first reports to an officer under paragraph (a), on a date fixed by the officer.

Subsection.Text: The designated foreign national must also report to an officer if requested to do so by the officer because the officer has reason to believe that any of the circumstances referred to in paragraphs 108(1)(a) to (e) of the Act may apply in respect of the designated foreign national.
In addition to meeting the requirements of subsections (1) and (2), the designated foreign national must report to an officer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any change in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their address, not more than 10 working days after the day on which the change occurs, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: their employment status, not more than 20 working days after the day on which the change occurs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any departure from Canada, not less than 10 working days before the day of their departure; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any return to Canada, not more than 10 working days after the day of their return.

Subsection.Text: The reporting requirements in subsections (1) to (3) cease to apply to the designated foreign national on the day on which they become a permanent resident.

For the purposes of subsection 21(2) of the Act, an officer shall not be satisfied that an applicant meets the conditions of that subsection if the determination or decision is subject to judicial review or if the time limit for commencing judicial review has not elapsed.

For the purposes of subsection 21(2) of the Act, an applicant who makes an application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident — and the family members included in the application — who intend to reside in the Province of Quebec as permanent residents and who are not persons whom the Board has determined to be Convention refugees, may become permanent residents only if it is established that the competent authority of that Province is of the opinion that they meet the selection criteria of the Province.
An applicant may include in their application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident any of their family members.

A family member who is included in an application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident and who is outside Canada at the time the application is made shall be issued a permanent resident visa if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the family member makes an application outside Canada to an officer within one year after the day on which the applicant becomes a permanent resident; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the family member is not inadmissible on the grounds referred to in subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: A family member who is inadmissible on any of the grounds referred to in subsection 21(2) of the Act shall not be issued a permanent resident visa and shall not become a permanent resident.

Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 21(2) of the Act, the following are prescribed as classes of persons who cannot become permanent residents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the class of persons who have been the subject of a decision under section 108 or 109 or subsection 114(3) of the Act resulting in the rejection of a claim for refugee protection or nullification of the decision that led to conferral of refugee protection;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the class of persons who are permanent residents at the time of their application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the class of persons who have been recognized by any country, other than Canada, as Convention refugees and who, if removed from Canada, would be allowed to return to that country;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the class of nationals or citizens of a country, other than the country that the person left, or outside of which the person remains, by reason of fear of persecution; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the class of persons who have permanently resided in a country, other than the country that the person left, or outside of which the person remains, by reason of fear of persecution, and who, if removed from Canada, would be allowed to return to that country.

Subsection.Text: An applicant who does not hold a document described in any of paragraphs 50(1)(a) to (h) may submit with their application

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any identity document issued outside Canada before the person’s entry into Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if there is a reasonable and objectively verifiable explanation related to circumstances in the applicant’s country of nationality or former habitual residence for the applicant’s inability to obtain any identity documents, a statutory declaration made by the applicant attesting to their identity, accompanied by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statutory declaration attesting to the applicant’s identity made by a person who, before the applicant’s entry into Canada, knew the applicant, a family member of the applicant or the applicant’s father, mother, brother, sister, grandfather or grandmother, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statutory declaration attesting to the applicant’s identity made by an official of an organization representing nationals of the applicant’s country of nationality or former habitual residence.

Subsection.Text: A document submitted under subsection (1) shall be accepted in lieu of a document described in any of paragraphs 50(1)(a) to (h) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an identity document, the identity document

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is genuine,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: identifies the applicant, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: constitutes credible evidence of the applicant’s identity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a statutory declaration, the declaration

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is consistent with any information previously provided by the applicant to the Department or the Board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: constitutes credible evidence of the applicant’s identity.

Section.Text: An officer shall issue a temporary resident visa to a foreign national if, following an examination, it is established that the foreign national

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has applied in accordance with these Regulations for a temporary resident visa as a member of the visitor, worker or student class;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: will leave Canada by the end of the period authorized for their stay under Division 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: holds a passport or other document that they may use to enter the country that issued it or another country;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements applicable to that class;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is not inadmissible;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of subsections 30(2) and (3), if they must submit to a medical examination under paragraph 16(2)(b) of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: is not the subject of a declaration made under subsection 22.1(1) of the Act.

Section.Text: A foreign national is not authorized to enter and remain in Canada as a temporary resident unless, following an examination, it is established that the foreign national and their accompanying family members

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: met the requirements for issuance of their temporary resident visa at the time it was issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: continue to meet these requirements at the time of the examination on entry into Canada.

Heading.TitleText: Applications for Extension of Authorization to Remain in Canada as a Temporary Resident

Subsection.Text: A foreign national may apply for an extension of their authorization to remain in Canada as a temporary resident if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application is made by the end of the period authorized for their stay; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they have complied with all conditions imposed on their entry into Canada.

Subsection.Text: An officer shall extend the foreign national’s authorization to remain in Canada as a temporary resident if, following an examination, it is established that the foreign national continues to meet the requirements of section 179.

On application made by a visitor, worker or student within 90 days after losing temporary resident status as a result of failing to comply with a condition imposed under paragraph 185(a), any of subparagraphs 185(b)(i) to (iii) or paragraph 185(c), an officer shall restore that status if, following an examination, it is established that the visitor, worker or student meets the initial requirements for their stay, has not failed to comply with any other conditions imposed and is not the subject of a declaration made under subsection 22.1(1) of the Act.
Despite subsection (1), an officer shall not restore the status of a student who is not in compliance with a condition set out in subsection 220.1(1).

Heading.Label: DIVISION 1.1
Heading.TitleText: Declaration Under Subsection 22.1(1) of the Act

Section.Text: If the Minister makes a declaration under subsection 22.1(1) of the Act in respect of a foreign national, the foreign national is considered to have been given notice of the declaration if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notice is sent by mail to their last known address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notice is sent to their last known email address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notice is provided to them by hand, including at a port of entry; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: notice is sent or provided by other reasonable means, if it is not possible to give notice by one of the means referred to in paragraphs (a) to (c).

Subsection.Text: A foreign national who is the subject of a declaration made under subsection 22.1(1) of the Act may make written submissions to the Minister as to why the declaration should be revoked or why its effective period should be shortened.
The written submissions must be made within 60 days after the day on which the notice of the declaration is sent or provided to the foreign national, as the case may be.
Subject to section 185, the following conditions are imposed on all temporary residents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to leave Canada by the end of the period authorized for their stay;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to not work, unless authorized by this Part or Part 11;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: if authorized to work by this Part or Part 11, to not enter into an employment agreement, or extend the term of an employment agreement, with an employer who, on a regular basis, offers striptease, erotic dance, escort services or erotic massages;

Paragraph.Label: (b.2)
Paragraph.Text: if authorized to work by this Part or Part 11, to not enter into an employment agreement, or extend the term of an employment agreement, with an employer referred to in any of subparagraphs 200(3)(h)(i) to (iii); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to not study, unless authorized by the Act, this Part or Part 12.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) to (5), the period authorized for the stay of a temporary resident is six months or any other period that is fixed by an officer on the basis of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the temporary resident’s means of support in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the period for which the temporary resident applies to stay; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry of the temporary resident’s passport or other travel document.

Subsection.Text: The period authorized for the stay of a temporary resident begins on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if they are authorized to enter and remain in Canada on a temporary basis, the day on which they first enter Canada after they are so authorized;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: if they have become a temporary resident in accordance with subsection 46(1.1) of the Act, the day on which their application to renounce their permanent resident status is approved; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the day on which they enter Canada.

Subsection.Text: The period authorized for a temporary resident’s stay ends on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the temporary resident leaves Canada without obtaining prior authorization to re-enter Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which their permit becomes invalid, in the case of a temporary resident who has been issued either a work permit or a study permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the second of their permits becomes invalid, in the case of a temporary resident who has been issued a work permit and a study permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which any temporary resident permit issued to the temporary resident is no longer valid under section 63; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the period authorized under subsection (2) ends, if paragraphs (a) to (c) do not apply.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Extension of period authorized for stay
Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5.1), if a temporary resident has applied for an extension of the period authorized for their stay and a decision is not made on the application by the end of the period authorized for their stay, the period is extended until

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which a decision is made, if the application is refused; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the end of the new period authorized for their stay, if the application is allowed.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (5) does not apply in respect of a foreign national who is the subject of a declaration made under subsection 22.1(1) of the Act.

If the period authorized for the stay of a temporary resident is extended by operation of paragraph (5)(a) or extended under paragraph (5)(b), the temporary resident retains their status, subject to any other conditions imposed, during the extended period.

Section.MarginalNote: Condition imposed on members of a crew

Subsection.Text: A foreign national who enters Canada as a member of a crew must leave Canada within 72 hours after they cease to be a member of a crew.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Conditions imposed on foreign nationals who enter to become members of a crew
Subsection.Text: The following conditions are imposed on a foreign national who enters Canada to become a member of a crew:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to join the means of transportation within the period imposed as a condition of entry or, if no period is imposed, within 48 hours after they enter Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to leave Canada within 72 hours after they cease to be a member of a crew.

Section.Text: An officer may impose, vary or cancel the following specific conditions on a temporary resident:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the period authorized for their stay;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the work that they are permitted to engage in, or are prohibited from engaging in, in Canada, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of work,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the location of the work,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the times and periods of the work, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a member of a crew, the period within which they must join the means of transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the studies that they are permitted to engage in, or are prohibited from engaging in, in Canada, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of studies or course,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the educational institution,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the location of the studies, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the times and periods of the studies;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the area within which they are permitted to travel or are prohibited from travelling in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the times and places at which they must report for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: medical examination, surveillance or treatment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the presentation of evidence of compliance with applicable conditions.

Section.Text: A foreign national may work in Canada without a work permit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as a business visitor to Canada within the meaning of section 187;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as a foreign representative, if they are properly accredited by the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade and are in Canada to carry out official duties as a diplomatic agent, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies or of any international organization of which Canada is a member;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the foreign national is a family member of a foreign representative in Canada who is accredited with diplomatic status by the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade and that Department has stated in writing that it does not object to the foreign national working in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: as a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, including a person who has been designated as a civilian component of those armed forces;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: as an officer of a foreign government sent, under an exchange agreement between Canada and one or more countries, to take up duties with a federal or provincial agency;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: as a cross-border maritime law enforcement officer designated by the United States under the Framework Agreement on Integrated Cross-Border Maritime Law Enforcement Operations between the Government of Canada and the Government of the United States of America, signed on May 26, 2009;

Paragraph.Label: (e.2)
Paragraph.Text: as an in-flight security officer employed by a foreign government with which Canada has concluded an arrangement in respect of commercial passenger aircraft security;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if they are a full-time student, on the campus of the university or college at which they are a full-time student, for the period for which they hold a study permit to study at that university or college;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: as a performing artist appearing alone or in a group in an artistic performance — other than a performance that is primarily for a film production or a television or radio broadcast — or as a member of the staff of such a performing artist or group who is integral to the artistic performance, if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they are part of a foreign production or group, or are a guest artist in a Canadian production or group, performing a time-limited engagement, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they are not in an employment relationship with the organization or business in Canada that is contracting for their services;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: as a participant in sports activities or events, in Canada, either as an individual participant or as a member of a foreign-based team or Canadian amateur team;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: as an employee of a foreign news company for the purpose of reporting on events in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: as a guest speaker for the sole purpose of making a speech or delivering a paper at a dinner, graduation, convention or similar function, or as a commercial speaker or seminar leader delivering a seminar that lasts no longer than five days;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: as a member of the executive of a committee that is organizing a convention or meeting in Canada or as a member of the administrative support staff of such a committee;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: as a person who is responsible for assisting a congregation or group in the achievement of its spiritual goals and whose main duties are to preach doctrine, perform functions related to gatherings of the congregation or group or provide spiritual counselling;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: as a judge, referee or similar official at an international amateur sports competition, an international cultural or artistic event or competition or an animal or agricultural competition;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: as an examiner or evaluator of research proposals or university projects, programs or theses;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: as an expert who conducts surveys or analyses that are to be used as evidence before a federal or provincial regulatory body, a tribunal or a court of law or as an expert witness before such a body, tribunal or court of law;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: as a student in a health field, including as a medical elective or clinical clerk at a medical teaching institution in Canada, for the primary purpose of acquiring training, if they have written approval from the body that regulates that field;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: as a civil aviation inspector of a national aeronautical authority conducting inspections of the flight operation procedures or cabin safety of a commercial air carrier operating international flights;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: as an accredited representative or adviser participating in an aviation accident or incident investigation conducted under the Canadian Transportation Accident Investigation and Safety Board Act;

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: as a member of a crew who is employed by a foreign company aboard a means of transportation that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is foreign-owned and not registered in Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is engaged primarily in international transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: as a provider of emergency services, including medical services, for the protection or preservation of life or property;

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: until a decision is made on an application made by them under subsection 201(1), if they have remained in Canada after the expiry of their work permit and they have continued to comply with the conditions set out on the expired work permit, other than the expiry date;

Paragraph.Label: (v)
Paragraph.Text: if they are the holder of a study permit and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they are a full-time student enrolled at a designated learning institution as defined in section 211.1,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the program in which they are enrolled is a post-secondary academic, vocational or professional training program, or a vocational training program at the secondary level offered in Quebec, in each case, of a duration of six months or more that leads to a degree, diploma or certificate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: although they are permitted to engage in full-time work during a regularly scheduled break between academic sessions, they work no more than 20 hours per week during a regular academic session; or

Paragraph.Label: (w)
Paragraph.Text: if they are or were the holder of a study permit who has completed their program of study and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they met the requirements set out in paragraph (v), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they applied for a work permit before the expiry of that study permit and a decision has not yet been made in respect of their application.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 186(a), a business visitor to Canada is a foreign national who is described in subsection (2) or who seeks to engage in international business activities in Canada without directly entering the Canadian labour market.
The following foreign nationals are business visitors:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: foreign nationals purchasing Canadian goods or services for a foreign business or government, or receiving training or familiarization in respect of such goods or services;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: foreign nationals receiving or giving training within a Canadian parent or subsidiary of the corporation that employs them outside Canada, if any production of goods or services that results from the training is incidental; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: foreign nationals representing a foreign business or government for the purpose of selling goods for that business or government, if the foreign national is not engaged in making sales to the general public in Canada.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (1), a foreign national seeks to engage in international business activities in Canada without directly entering the Canadian labour market only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the primary source of remuneration for the business activities is outside Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the principal place of business and actual place of accrual of profits remain predominately outside Canada.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national may study in Canada without a study permit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if they are a family member or a member of the private staff of a foreign representative who is properly accredited by the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade and who is in Canada to carry out official duties as a diplomatic agent, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies or of any international organization of which Canada is a member;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, including a person who has been designated as a civilian component of those armed forces;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the duration of their course or program of studies is six months or less and will be completed within the period for their stay authorized upon entry into Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if they are an Indian.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(c), a foreign national may apply for a study permit before entering Canada for a course or program of studies of a duration of six months or less.

Section.Text: A foreign national who has made an application under subsection 217(1) is authorized to study without a study permit until a decision is made on the application if they have remained in Canada since the expiry of their study permit and continue to comply with the conditions, other than the expiry date, set out on the expired study permit.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national is exempt from the requirement to obtain a temporary resident visa if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are a citizen of a country listed in Schedule 1.1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a British citizen,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a British overseas citizen who is re-admissible to the United Kingdom, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a citizen of a British overseas territory who derives that citizenship through birth, descent, naturalization or registration in one of the British overseas territories of Anguilla, Bermuda, British Virgin Islands, Cayman Islands, Falkland Islands, Gibraltar, Montserrat, Pitcairn Island, Saint Helena or Turks and Caicos Islands; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are a national of the United States or a person who has been lawfully admitted to the United States for permanent residence.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national is exempt from the requirement to obtain a temporary resident visa if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: hold a passport that contains a diplomatic acceptance, a consular acceptance or an official acceptance issued by the Chief of Protocol for the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade on behalf of the Government of Canada and are a properly accredited diplomat, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies, or of any international organization of which Canada is a member;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: hold a passport or travel document issued by the Holy See;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: hold a national Israeli passport;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: hold a passport issued by the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: hold a passport issued by the United Kingdom to a British National (Overseas), as a person born, naturalized or registered in Hong Kong;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: hold a passport issued by the United Kingdom to a British Subject which contains the observation that the holder has the right of abode in the United Kingdom; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: hold an ordinary passport issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Taiwan that includes the personal identification number of the individual.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Visa exemption — holders of certain Romanian passports
Subsection.Text: A foreign national who is a citizen of Romania is exempt from the requirement to obtain a temporary resident visa if they hold a machine-readable passport that contains a contactless integrated circuit chip and that is issued by Romania.
A foreign national is exempt from the requirement to obtain a temporary resident visa if they are seeking to enter and remain in Canada solely

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to an agreement between Canada and one or more foreign countries respecting the obligation to hold such a visa,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: as a member of a crew of a means of transportation other than a vessel or to become a member of a crew of a means of transportation other than a vessel, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to transit through Canada after working, or to work, as a member of a crew of a means of transportation other than a vessel, if they possess a ticket for departure from Canada within 24 hours after their arrival in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to transit through Canada as a passenger on a flight stopping in Canada for the sole purpose of refuelling and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they are in possession of the documents required in order to enter the United States and their flight is bound for that country, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they were lawfully admitted to the United States and their flight originated in that country;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: to transit through Canada as a passenger on a flight that, owing to an emergency or other unforeseen circumstances, makes an unscheduled stop in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to transit through Canada as a passenger on a flight if the foreign national

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is transported by a commercial transporter and there is a memorandum of understanding referred to in subsection (4) in effect between the Minister and the commercial transporter concerning the transit of passengers through Canada without a Canadian visa,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: holds a passport or travel document that was issued by the country of which the foreign national is a citizen or national and that country is listed in the memorandum of understanding, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is in possession of any visa required to enter the country of destination;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to carry out official duties as a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, unless they have been designated under that Act as a civilian component of those armed forces;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: to re-enter Canada following a visit solely to the United States or St. Pierre and Miquelon, if they

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: held a study permit or a work permit that was issued before they left Canada on such a visit or were authorized to enter and remain in Canada as a temporary resident, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: return to Canada by the end of the period initially authorized for their stay or any extension to it;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: to conduct inspections of the flight operation procedures or cabin safety of a commercial air carrier operating international flights, if they are a civil aviation inspector of a national aeronautical authority and possess valid documentation to that effect; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: to participate as an accredited representative or as an adviser to an aviation accident or incident investigation conducted under the Canadian Transportation Accident Investigation and Safety Board Act, if they possess valid documentation to that effect.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national who is a member of a crew and who is carried to Canada by a vessel is exempt from the requirement to obtain a temporary resident visa if they are seeking

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to enter Canada as a member of the crew of the vessel; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to remain in Canada solely as a member of the crew of that vessel or any other vessel.

Subsection.Text: A memorandum of understanding referred to in paragraph (3)(c) shall include provisions respecting

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the countries to which the memorandum of understanding applies;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the scheduled flights to which the memorandum of understanding applies; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the commercial transporter’s obligation to control the movement of in-transit passengers.

Section.Text: The visitor class is prescribed as a class of persons who may become temporary residents.
A foreign national is a visitor and a member of the visitor class if the foreign national has been authorized to enter and remain in Canada as a visitor.
A visitor is subject to the conditions imposed under Part 9.
The worker class is prescribed as a class of persons who may become temporary residents.
A foreign national is a worker and a member of the worker class if the foreign national has been authorized to enter and remain in Canada as a worker.
A foreign national must not work in Canada unless authorized to do so by a work permit or these Regulations.
A foreign national must not enter into an employment agreement, or extend the term of an employment agreement, with an employer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: who, on a regular basis, offers striptease, erotic dance, escort services or erotic massages; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: referred to in any of subparagraphs 200(3)(h)(i) to (iii).

Section.Text: For the purpose of this Part abuse consists of any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: physical abuse, including assault and forcible confinement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sexual abuse, including sexual contact without consent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: psychological abuse, including threats and intimidation; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: financial abuse, including fraud and extortion.

Section.Text: A foreign national may apply for a work permit at any time before entering Canada.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a foreign national may apply for a work permit when entering Canada if the foreign national is exempt under Division 5 of Part 9 from the requirement to obtain a temporary resident visa.
A foreign national may not apply for a work permit when entering Canada if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a determination under section 203 is required, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Department of Employment and Social Development has provided an assessment under paragraph 203(2)(a) in respect of an offer of employment — other than seasonal agricultural employment — to the foreign national, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the foreign national is a national or permanent resident of the United States or is a resident of Greenland or St. Pierre and Miquelon;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national does not hold a medical certificate that they are required to hold under subsection 30(3); or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national is a participant in an international youth exchange program, unless they are a national or permanent resident of the United States or their application for a work permit was approved before their entry into Canada.

Section.Text: A foreign national may apply for a work permit after entering Canada if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: hold a work permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are working in Canada under the authority of section 186 and are not a business visitor within the meaning of section 187;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: hold a study permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: hold a temporary resident permit issued under subsection 24(1) of the Act that is valid for at least six months;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: are a family member of a person described in any of paragraphs (a) to (d);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: are in a situation described in section 206 or 207;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: applied for a work permit before entering Canada and the application was approved in writing but they have not been issued the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: are applying as a trader or investor, intra-company transferee or professional, as described in Section B, C or D of Annex 1603 of the Agreement, within the meaning of subsection 2(1) of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act, and their country of citizenship — being a country party to that Agreement — grants to Canadian citizens who submit a similar application within that country treatment equivalent to that accorded by Canada to citizens of that country who submit an application within Canada, including treatment in respect of an authorization for multiple entries based on a single application; or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: hold a written statement from the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade stating that it has no objection to the foreign national working at a foreign mission in Canada.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) — and, in respect of a foreign national who makes an application for a work permit before entering Canada, subject to section 87.3 of the Act — an officer shall issue a work permit to a foreign national if, following an examination, it is established that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national applied for it in accordance with Division 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national will leave Canada by the end of the period authorized for their stay under Division 2 of Part 9;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is described in section 206 or 208,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: intends to perform work described in section 204 or 205 but does not have an offer of employment to perform that work or is described in section 207 but does not have an offer of employment,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii.1)
Subparagraph.Text: intends to perform work described in section 204 or 205 and has an offer of employment to perform that work or is described in section 207 and has an offer of employment, and an officer has determined, on the basis of any information provided on the officer’s request by the employer making the offer and any other relevant information,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: that the offer is genuine under subsection (5), and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: that the employer, except an employer referred to in any of paragraphs 209.91(a) to (d),

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: during the six-year period before the day on which the application for the work permit is received by the Department, provided each foreign national employed by the employer with employment in the same occupation as that set out in the foreign national’s offer of employment and with wages and working conditions that were substantially the same as — but not less favourable than — those set out in that offer, or

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: is able to justify, under subsection 203(1.1), any failure to satisfy the criteria set out in subclause (I), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: has been offered employment, and an officer has made a positive determination under paragraphs 203(1)(a) to (e); and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements of subsections 30(2) and (3) are met, if they must submit to a medical examination under paragraph 16(2)(b) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply to a foreign national who satisfies the criteria set out in section 206 or paragraph 207(c) or (d).
An officer shall not issue a work permit to a foreign national if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there are reasonable grounds to believe that the foreign national is unable to perform the work sought;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national who intends to work in the Province of Quebec and does not hold a Certificat d’acceptation du Québec, a determination under section 203 is required and the laws of that Province require that the foreign national hold a Certificat d’acceptation du Québec;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the work that the foreign national intends to perform is likely to adversely affect the settlement of any labour dispute in progress or the employment of any person involved in the dispute;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national has engaged in unauthorized study or work in Canada or has failed to comply with a condition of a previous permit or authorization unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a period of six months has elapsed since the cessation of the unauthorized work or study or failure to comply with a condition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the study or work was unauthorized by reason only that the foreign national did not comply with conditions imposed under paragraph 185(a), any of subparagraphs 185(b)(i) to (iii) or paragraph 185(c);

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: section 206 applies to them; or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the foreign national was subsequently issued a temporary resident permit under subsection 24(1) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national referred to in subparagraphs (1)(c)(i) to (iii), the issuance of a work permit would be inconsistent with the terms of a federal-provincial agreement that apply to the employment of foreign nationals;

Paragraph.Label: (f.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national referred to in subparagraph (1)(c)(ii.1), the fee referred to in section 303.1 has not been paid or the information referred to in section 209.11 has not been provided before the foreign national makes an application for a work permit;

Paragraph.Label: (g.1)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national intends to work for an employer who, on a regular basis, offers striptease, erotic dance, escort services or erotic massages; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national intends to work for an employer who is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to a determination made under subsection 203(5), if two years have not elapsed since the day on which that determination was made,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ineligible under paragraph 209.95(1)(b), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in default of any amount payable in respect of an administrative monetary penalty, including if the employer fails to comply with a payment agreement for the payment of that amount.

Subsection.Text: A determination of whether an offer of employment is genuine shall be based on the following factors:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether the offer is made by an employer that is actively engaged in the business in respect of which the offer is made, unless the offer is made for employment as a live-in caregiver;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether the offer is consistent with the reasonable employment needs of the employer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whether the terms of the offer are terms that the employer is reasonably able to fulfil; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the past compliance of the employer, or any person who recruited the foreign national for the employer, with the federal or provincial laws that regulate employment, or the recruiting of employees, in the province in which it is intended that the foreign national work.

Subsection.Text: A foreign national may apply for the renewal of their work permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application is made before their work permit expires; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they have complied with all conditions imposed on their entry into Canada.

Subsection.Text: An officer shall renew the foreign national’s work permit if, following an examination, it is established that the foreign national continues to meet the requirements of section 200.

Section.Text: A foreign national who is issued a work permit under section 206 or paragraph 207(c) or (d) does not, by reason only of being issued a work permit, become a temporary resident.

Subsection.Text: On application under Division 2 for a work permit made by a foreign national other than a foreign national referred to in subparagraphs 200(1)(c)(i) to (ii.1), an officer must determine, on the basis of an assessment provided by the Department of Employment and Social Development, of any information provided on the officer’s request by the employer making the offer and of any other relevant information, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the job offer is genuine under subsection 200(5);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the employment of the foreign national is likely to have a neutral or positive effect on the labour market in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance of a work permit would not be inconsistent with the terms of any federal-provincial agreement that apply to the employers of foreign nationals;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national who seeks to enter Canada as a live-in caregiver,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the foreign national will reside in a private household in Canada and provide child care, senior home support care or care of a disabled person in that household without supervision,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer will provide the foreign national with adequate furnished and private accommodations in the household, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer has sufficient financial resources to pay the foreign national the wages that are offered to the foreign national; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the employer

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: during the period beginning six years before the day on which the request for an assessment under subsection (2) is received by the Department of Employment and Social Development and ending on the day on which the application for the work permit is received by the Department, provided each foreign national employed by the employer with employment in the same occupation as that set out in the foreign national’s offer of employment and with wages and working conditions that were substantially the same as — but not less favourable than — those set out in that offer, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is able to justify, under subsection (1.1), any failure to satisfy the criteria set out in subparagraph (i).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(b), the employment of a foreign national is unlikely to have a positive or neutral effect on the labour market in Canada if the offer of employment requires the ability to communicate in a language other than English or French, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the employer or group of employers demonstrates that the ability to communicate in the other language is a bona fide requirement for performing the duties associated with the employment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the offer of employment relates to work to be performed under an international agreement between Canada and one or more countries concerning seasonal agricultural workers; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offer of employment relates to other work to be performed in the primary agriculture sector, within the meaning of subsection 315.2(4).

Subsection.Text: A failure to satisfy the criteria set out in subparagraph (1)(e)(i) is justified if it results from

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change in federal or provincial law;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a change to the provisions of a collective agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the implementation of measures by the employer in response to a dramatic change in economic conditions that directly affected the business of the employer, provided that the measures were not directed disproportionately at foreign nationals employed by the employer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an error in interpretation made in good faith by the employer with respect to its obligations to a foreign national, if the employer subsequently provided compensation — or if it was not possible to provide compensation, made sufficient efforts to do so — to all foreign nationals who suffered a disadvantage as a result of the error;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an unintentional accounting or administrative error made by the employer, if the employer subsequently provided compensation — or if it was not possible to provide compensation, made sufficient efforts to do so — to all foreign nationals who suffered a disadvantage as a result of the error;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: circumstances similar to those set out in paragraphs (a) to (e); or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: force majeure.

Subsection.Text: The Department of Employment and Social Development must provide the assessment referred to in subsection (1) on the request of an officer or an employer or group of employers, none of whom is an employer who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on a regular basis, offers striptease, erotic dance, escort services or erotic massages; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is referred to in any of subparagraphs 200(3)(h)(i) to (iii).

Subsection.Text: A request may be made in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offer of employment to a foreign national; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: offers of employment made, or anticipated to be made, by an employer or group of employers.

Subsection.Text: The assessment provided by the Department of Employment and Social Development on the matters set out in paragraphs (1)(a) to (e) must be based on any information provided by the employer making the offer and any other relevant information, but, for the purposes of this subsection, the period referred to in subparagraph (1)(e)(i) ends on the day on which the request for the assessment is received by that Department.

An assessment provided by the Department of Employment and Social Development with respect to the matters referred to in paragraph (1)(b) shall, unless the employment of the foreign national is unlikely to have a positive or neutral effect on the labour market in Canada as a result of the application of subsection (1.01), be based on the following factors:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether the employment of the foreign national will or is likely to result in direct job creation or job retention for Canadian citizens or permanent residents;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether the employment of the foreign national will or is likely to result in the development or transfer of skills and knowledge for the benefit of Canadian citizens or permanent residents;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whether the employment of the foreign national is likely to fill a labour shortage;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whether the wages offered to the foreign national are consistent with the prevailing wage rate for the occupation and whether the working conditions meet generally accepted Canadian standards;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: whether the employer will hire or train Canadian citizens or permanent residents or has made, or has agreed to make, reasonable efforts to do so;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: whether the employment of the foreign national is likely to adversely affect the settlement of any labour dispute in progress or the employment of any person involved in the dispute; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: whether the employer has fulfilled or has made reasonable efforts to fulfill any commitments made, in the context of any assessment that was previously provided under subsection (2), with respect to the matters referred to in paragraphs (a), (b) and (e).

Subsection.Text: An assessment provided by the Department of Employment and Social Development shall indicate the period during which the assessment is in effect for the purposes of subsection (1).

In the case of a foreign national who intends to work in the Province of Quebec, the assessment provided by the Department of Employment and Social Development shall be made in concert with the competent authority of that Province.

If an officer determines that the criteria set out in subclause 200(1)(c)(ii.1)(B)(I) or subparagraph (1)(e)(i) were not satisfied and the failure to do so was not justified by the employer under subsection (1.1), the Department must notify the employer of that determination and that the information referred to in subsection 209.997(2) will be added to the list referred to in that subsection.
If an officer makes a determination under subsection (5), the Department must add the information referred to in subsection 209.997(2) to the list referred to in that subsection.

Section.Text: A work permit may be issued under section 200 to a foreign national who intends to perform work under

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an agreement or arrangement between Canada and the government of a foreign state or an international organization, other than an agreement or arrangement concerning seasonal agricultural workers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an agreement entered into by one or more countries and by or on behalf of one or more provinces; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an agreement entered into by the Minister with a province or group of provinces under subsection 8(1) of the Act.

Section.Text: A work permit may be issued under section 200 to a foreign national who intends to perform work that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: would create or maintain significant social, cultural or economic benefits or opportunities for Canadian citizens or permanent residents;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: would create or maintain reciprocal employment of Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada in other countries;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is designated by the Minister as being work that can be performed by a foreign national on the basis of the following criteria, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the work is related to a research program,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.1)
Subparagraph.Text: the work is an essential part of a post-secondary academic, vocational or professional training program offered by a designated learning institution as defined in section 211.1,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.2)
Subparagraph.Text: the work is an essential part of a program at the secondary level

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: that is a vocational training program offered by a designated learning institution in Quebec, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: that is a program offered by a designated learning institution that requires students to work in order to obtain their secondary or high school diploma or certificate of graduation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: limited access to the Canadian labour market is necessary for reasons of public policy relating to the competitiveness of Canada’s academic institutions or economy; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is of a religious or charitable nature.

Subsection.Text: A work permit may be issued under section 200 to a foreign national in Canada who cannot support themself without working, if the foreign national

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has made a claim for refugee protection that has been referred to the Refugee Protection Division but has not been determined; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is subject to an unenforceable removal order.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), a work permit must not be issued to a claimant referred to in subsection 111.1(2) of the Act unless at least 180 days have elapsed since their claim was referred to the Refugee Protection Division.

Section.Text: A work permit may be issued under section 200 to a foreign national in Canada who

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class set out in Division 2 of Part 7;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is a protected person within the meaning of subsection 95(2) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has applied to become a permanent resident and the Minister has granted them an exemption under subsection 25(1), 25.1(1) or 25.2(1) of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is a family member of a person described in any of paragraphs (a) to (d).

Section.Text: A work permit may be issued under section 200 to a foreign national in Canada who cannot support themself without working, if the foreign national

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: holds a study permit and has become temporarily destitute through circumstances beyond their control and beyond the control of any person on whom that person is dependent for the financial support to complete their term of study; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: holds a temporary resident permit issued under subsection 24(1) of the Act that is valid for at least six months.

Section.Text: A work permit becomes invalid when it expires or when a removal order that is made against the permit holder becomes enforceable.
For the purposes of this Division, document means anything on which information that is capable of being understood by a person, or read by a computer or other device, is recorded or marked.

Section.MarginalNote: Foreign national referred to in subparagraph 200(1)(c)(ii.1)

Subsection.Text: An employer who has made an offer of employment to a foreign national referred to in subparagraph 200(1)(c)(ii.1) must, before the foreign national makes an application for a work permit in respect of that employment, provide the following information to the Minister by means of the electronic system that is made available by the Department for that purpose:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, address and telephone number and their fax number and electronic mail address, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the business number assigned to the employer by the Minister of National Revenue, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information that demonstrates that the foreign national will be performing work described in section 204 or 205 or is a foreign national described in section 207; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the offer of employment made in the form made available by the Department.

Subsection.Text: The information is deemed to be received on the date and at the time recorded in the electronic system.

If an employer is unable to provide the information by means of the electronic system because of a physical or mental disability, the information may be provided by another means that is made available by the Department for that purpose and that would enable the employer to provide the information, including a paper form.

Section.MarginalNote: Foreign national referred to in subparagraph 200(1)(c)(ii.1)

Subsection.Text: An employer who has made an offer of employment to a foreign national referred to in subparagraph 200(1)(c)(ii.1) must comply with the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the period of employment for which the work permit is issued to the foreign national,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must be actively engaged in the business in respect of which the offer of employment was made, unless the offer was made for employment as a live-in caregiver,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must comply with the federal and provincial laws that regulate employment, and the recruiting of employees, in the province in which the foreign national works,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must provide the foreign national with employment in the same occupation as that set out in the foreign national’s offer of employment and with wages and working conditions that are substantially the same as — but not less favourable than — those set out in that offer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must make reasonable efforts to provide a workplace that is free of abuse; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during a period of six years beginning on the first day of the period of employment for which the work permit is issued to the foreign national, the employer must

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be able to demonstrate that any information they provided under subparagraph 200(1)(c)(ii.1) or section 209.11 was accurate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: retain any document that relates to compliance with the conditions set out in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the period of employment for which the work permit is issued includes any period during which the foreign national may, under paragraph 186(u), work in Canada without a permit after the expiry of their work permit.
A failure to comply with any of the conditions set out in paragraph (1)(a) is justified if it results from any of the circumstances set out in subsection 203(1.1).
A failure to comply with either of the conditions set out in paragraph (1)(b) is justified if the employer made all reasonable efforts to comply with the condition.

Section.MarginalNote: Foreign national referred to in subparagraph 200(1)(c)(iii)

Subsection.Text: An employer who has made an offer of employment to a foreign national referred to in subparagraph 200(1)(c)(iii) must comply with the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the period of employment for which the work permit is issued to the foreign national,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must be actively engaged in the business in respect of which the offer of employment was made, unless the offer was made for employment as a live-in caregiver,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must comply with the federal and provincial laws that regulate employment, and the recruiting of employees, in the province in which the foreign national works,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer, in the case of an employer who employs a foreign national as a live-in caregiver, must

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: ensure that the foreign national resides in a private household in Canada and provides child care, senior home support care or care of a disabled person in that household without supervision,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: provide the foreign national with adequate furnished and private accommodations in the household, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: have sufficient financial resources to pay the foreign national the wages that were offered to the foreign national,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must provide the foreign national with employment in the same occupation as that set out in the foreign national’s offer of employment and with wages and working conditions that are substantially the same as — but not less favourable than — those set out in that offer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must make reasonable efforts to provide a workplace that is free of abuse;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the period of employment for which the work permit is issued to the foreign national or any other period that was agreed on by the employer and the Department of Employment and Social Development at the time the assessment referred to in subsection 203(2) was provided,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must ensure that the employment of the foreign national will result in direct job creation or job retention for Canadian citizens or permanent residents, if that was one of the factors that led to the issuance of the work permit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must ensure that the employment of the foreign national will result in the development or transfer of skills and knowledge for the benefit of Canadian citizens or permanent residents, if that was one of the factors that led to the issuance of the work permit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must hire or train Canadian citizens or permanent residents, if that was one of the factors that led to the issuance of the work permit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the employer must make reasonable efforts to hire or train Canadian citizens or permanent residents, if that was one of the factors that led to the issuance of the work permit; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during a period of six years beginning on the first day of the period of employment for which the work permit is issued to the foreign national, the employer must

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be able to demonstrate that any information they provided under subsections 203(1) and (2.1) was accurate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: retain any document that relates to compliance with the conditions set out in paragraphs (a) and (b).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the period of employment for which the work permit is issued includes any period during which the foreign national may, under paragraph 186(u), work in Canada without a permit after the expiry of their work permit.
A failure to comply with any of the conditions set out in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) is justified if it results from any of the circumstances set out in subsection 203(1.1).
A failure to comply with either of the conditions set out in paragraph (1)(c) is justified if the employer made all reasonable efforts to comply with the condition.
An employer referred to in section 209.2 or 209.3 must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: report at any specified time and place to answer questions and provide documents, in accordance with section 209.6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide any documents that are required under section 209.7; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: attend any inspection referred to in section 209.8 or 209.9, unless the employer was not notified of it, give all reasonable assistance to the person conducting that inspection and provide that person with any document or information that the person requires.

Subsection.Text: A failure to comply with any of the conditions set out in subsection (1) is justified if the employer made all reasonable efforts to comply with the condition or if it results from anything done or omitted to be done by the employer in good faith.

Section.MarginalNote: Circumstances for exercise of powers – sections 209.6 to 209.9
Section.Text: The powers set out in sections 209.6 to 209.9 may be exercised in the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an officer or the Minister of Employment and Social Development has a reason to suspect that the employer is not complying or has not complied with any of the conditions set out in section 209.2 or 209.3;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the employer has not complied with the conditions set out in section 209.2 or 209.3 in the past; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the employer is chosen as part of a random verification of compliance with the conditions set out in sections 209.2 and 209.3.

Subsection.Text: If any of the circumstances set out in section 209.5 exists,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an officer may, for the purpose of verifying compliance with the conditions set out in section 209.2, require an employer to report at any specified time and place to answer questions and provide documents that relate to compliance with those conditions; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
