Paragraph.Text: were the lawful owner prior to its seizure and have remained a lawful owner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: did not profit or intend to profit from the fraudulent or improper use of the vehicle; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are unlikely to contravene the Act in the future.

Subsection.Text: A thing seized shall only be returned if its return would not be contrary to the purposes of the Act.

The applicant shall be notified in writing of the decision on the application and the reasons for it. If the applicant is notified by mail, notification is deemed to have been effected on the seventh day after the day on which the notification was mailed.

Section.MarginalNote: Application by person from whom thing was seized

Subsection.Text: If a thing was seized on the ground that it was fraudulently or improperly obtained or used, a person from whom it was seized may apply in writing within 30 days after the seizure for its return.
The thing seized shall be returned to an applicant if the applicant demonstrates that it was not fraudulently or improperly obtained or used.

An applicant shall be notified in writing of the decision on the application and the reasons for it. If the applicant is notified by mail, notification is deemed to have been effected on the seventh day after the day on which the notification was mailed.

Subject to subsections (2) and (3), if a thing seized is not returned to its lawful owner or the person from whom it was seized under section 254, 255 or 256, the thing shall be sold unless the costs of sale would exceed the monetary value of the thing, in which case the thing shall be destroyed.
A thing seized shall not be sold

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the 15 days following notification of a decision not to return it under section 255 or 256; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: before a final decision is made in any judicial proceeding in Canada affecting the seizure or the return of the thing seized.

Subsection.Text: If a document is not returned to its lawful owner or the person from whom it was seized, the document shall be retained for as long as is necessary for the administration or enforcement of Canadian laws, after which it is subject to the applicable laws relating to the disposal of public archives.

Section.Text: No seizure may be made under subsection 140(1) of the Act in respect of the fraudulent or improper obtaining or use of a thing more than six years after that obtaining or use.
For the purposes of paragraph 148(1)(a) of the Act, the following persons are prescribed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any foreign national who is the subject of a declaration made under subsection 22.1(1) of the Act, unless they hold a temporary resident permit issued under section 24 of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any foreign national who is not authorized under subsection 52(1) of the Act to return to Canada.

Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 148(1) of the Act, the following documents that a person requires under the Act to enter Canada are prescribed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a travel document referred to in subsection 31(3) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: refugee travel papers issued by the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document referred to in subsection 50(1) or 52(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a temporary travel document referred to in section 151;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a visa referred to in section 6 or subsection 7(1);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a permanent resident card; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an electronic travel authorization referred to in section 7.01 or 7.1.

Subsection.Text: If a commercial transporter has reasonable grounds to believe that the prescribed documents of a person whom it carries to Canada may not be available for examination at a port of entry, the commercial transporter must give the person a receipt for the documents and hold the documents until examination.
A commercial transporter that holds the documents of a person must, when presenting the person for examination under paragraph 148(1)(b) of the Act, present the documents and a copy of the receipt.
For the purposes of paragraph 148(1)(b) of the Act, a transporter has complied with the obligation to hold a person until the examination is completed when

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an officer informs the transporter that the examination of the person is completed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person is authorized to enter Canada under section 23 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person is detained under any Canadian law.

Subsection.Text: A transporter must notify an officer without delay if a person whose examination has not been completed leaves or attempts to leave the transporter’s vehicle for any other purpose than examination.

Section.Text: On the arrival of a vessel at its first port of call in Canada, the transporter must notify an officer at the nearest port of entry of the presence of any stowaway and, on request of the officer, must without delay provide a written report concerning the stowaway.

Subsection.Text: A commercial transporter must arrange for the medical examination of a foreign national who is required to submit to one under paragraph 16(2)(b) of the Act and for any medical examination, surveillance or treatment that is imposed under section 32.
Subsection (1) does not apply if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national holds a temporary or permanent resident visa at the time of their examination and the foreign national’s health condition is not a result of the commercial transporter’s negligence; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national has been authorized to enter and remain in Canada and is not a member of the crew.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 148(1)(g) of the Act, any medical costs incurred with respect to the foreign national are prescribed costs and are to be calculated on the basis of the applicable provincial health insurance system.

Section.Text: A transporter must provide without delay any of the following documents that are requested by an officer within 72 hours after the presentation for examination of a person carried by the transporter to Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any ticket issued to the person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a document specifying the person’s itinerary, including the place of embarkation and dates of travel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document identifying the document number and type of passport, travel document or identity document carried by the person, the country of issue and the name of the person to whom it was issued.

Subsection.Text: On arrival at the first port of call in Canada of a vessel registered in a foreign country, the transporter must provide an officer at the nearest port of entry with a list of all members of the crew.
The transporter must maintain on board a current list of all members of the crew while the vessel is in Canada.

Before the vessel’s departure from its final port of call in Canada, the transporter must provide an officer with a copy of the list referred to in subsection (1) that includes any changes made while the vessel was in Canada.

Section.Text: On the request of an officer, a transporter must assemble without delay aboard the vessel all members of the crew.

On the arrival of a vessel registered in Canada at its first port of call in Canada, the transporter must notify an officer at the nearest port of entry of all members of the crew who are not Canadian citizens or permanent residents and, on request, provide the officer with a list of all crew members.

Subsection.Text: A transporter must, without delay, notify an officer at the nearest port of entry of any foreign national who ceases to be a member of the crew for a reason listed in paragraph 3(1)(b). The transporter must record that information and provide it in writing on the request of the officer.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Failure to join means of transportation
Subsection.Text: A transporter must, without delay, notify an officer at the nearest port of entry when a foreign national who entered Canada to become a member of the crew of the transporter’s vessel fails to join the means of transportation within the period provided in paragraph 184(2)(b).

On the request of an official of the Canada Border Services Agency, a commercial transporter that carries or expects to carry persons to Canada on board its commercial vehicle must provide the Canada Border Services Agency with the following information about each person whom it expects to carry:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their surname, first name and any middle names, their date of birth, their citizenship or nationality and their gender;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type and number of each passport or other travel document that identifies them and the name of the country or entity that issued it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: their reservation record locator number, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the unique passenger reference assigned to them by the commercial transporter, if any, or, in the case of a crew member who has not been assigned one, notice of their status as a crew member;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any information about the person that is in a reservation system of the commercial transporter or its agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the following information about their carriage on board the commercial vehicle:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the person is carried or is expected to be carried on board the commercial vehicle by air, the date and time of take-off from the last point of embarkation of persons before the commercial vehicle arrives in Canada or, if the person is carried or is expected to be carried on board the vehicle by water or land, the date and time of departure from the last point of embarkation of persons before the commercial vehicle arrives in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the last point of embarkation of persons before the commercial vehicle arrives in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date and time of arrival of the commercial vehicle at the first point of disembarkation of persons in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the first point of disembarkation of persons in Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a commercial vehicle that carries persons or goods by air, the flight code identifying the commercial transporter and the flight number.

Subsection.Text: The information referred to in subsection (1) must be provided by electronic means in accordance with the technical requirements, specifications and procedures for electronic data interchange set out in the document entitled CBSA Carrier Messaging Requirements issued by the Canada Border Services Agency, as amended from time to time.
The information referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) must be provided

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not later than one hour before the time of departure, if the information relates to a member of the crew; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not later than the time of check-in, if the information relates to any other person who is expected to be on board the commercial vehicle.

Subsection.Text: The information referred to in paragraph (1)(e) must be provided not later than at the time of departure.

The information referred to in paragraph (1)(d) must also be provided, for each passenger who is on board the commercial vehicle at the time of departure, not later than 30 minutes after the time of departure.

A commercial transporter that becomes aware before or at the time of departure that information they have provided under paragraph 148(1)(d) of the Act is incomplete or inaccurate must, in the manner described in subsection (2) and without delay, provide the Canada Border Services Agency with the missing or accurate information.
Subsection (6) does not apply in respect of information referred to in paragraph (1)(e).
The information referred to in paragraph (1)(f) must be provided at the same time that any information referred to in subsections (3) to (7) is provided.

The Canada Border Services Agency may retain information referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d) about a person for up to three years and six months after the day of departure of the commercial vehicle that carried or was to carry the person to Canada.

After the period referred to in subsection (9), the Canada Border Services Agency may retain the information referred to in that subsection about a person for as long as it is required as part of an investigation, but in no case longer than six years after the day of departure of the commercial vehicle that carried or was to carry the person to Canada.

Section.MarginalNote: Notice by Canada Border Services Agency

Subsection.Text: The Canada Border Services Agency may notify a commercial transporter that a person whom it expects to carry to Canada may be a person who is prescribed under section 258.1 or may be a person who does not hold the necessary documents prescribed under section 259.
For greater certainty, subsection (1) does not relieve a commercial transporter of its obligation to comply with any requirement imposed by the Act or these Regulations.

A commercial transporter, and a transporter who operates an airport or an international bridge or tunnel, must without cost to Her Majesty in right of Canada provide and maintain facilities, including areas, offices and laboratories, that are adequate for the proper holding and examination of persons being carried to Canada.

The facilities referred to in subsection (1) are adequate if they satisfy the applicable requirements of Part II of the Canada Labour Code, are secure and, if necessary, sterile, and include equipment and furnishings that permit officers to discharge their duties under the Act.

Section.Text: A commercial transporter carrying persons to Canada aboard its vessel must provide facilities aboard the vessel that permit an officer to conduct examinations.

Subsection.Text: A commercial transporter that has carried a foreign national referred to in this subsection to Canada or caused such a foreign national to be carried to Canada must, without delay, carry the foreign national from Canada

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to any other country, in the case of a foreign national directed to leave under subsection 40(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the United States, in the case of a foreign national directed back to that country under section 41;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to any other country, in the case of a foreign national allowed to withdraw their application under section 42; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to the country to which the foreign national is removed under section 241, in the case of a foreign national who is subject to an enforceable removal order.

Subsection.Text: The transporter must transport a foreign national who is subject to an enforceable removal order from wherever the foreign national is situated in Canada to the vehicle in which they will be carried to another country.

If a transporter carries, or causes to be carried, a foreign national to Canada as a member of its crew or to become a member of its crew, and the foreign national is subject to an enforceable removal order, the transporter must carry that foreign national from Canada to the applicable country as determined under Division 4 of Part 13.

The transporter must transport the foreign national referred to in subsection (1) from wherever the foreign national is situated in Canada to the vehicle in which they will be carried to another country.

Section.Text: A transporter must notify an officer without delay if a foreign national referred to in section 273 or 274 whom they are carrying from Canada leaves or attempts to leave a vehicle before they are carried from Canada.

Subsection.Text: When a foreign national who seeks to enter Canada is made subject to a removal order and a commercial transporter is or may be required under the Act to carry that foreign national from Canada, an officer must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notify the commercial transporter that it is or may be required to carry the foreign national from Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when the removal order is enforceable, notify the commercial transporter of its obligation to carry the foreign national from Canada and, if an escort is necessary, request the commercial transporter to provide an escort or to make arrangements for the carriage of an escort assigned by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: After being notified under paragraph (1)(b), the commercial transporter must, without delay,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: make arrangements to carry the foreign national from Canada and notify an officer of those arrangements; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify an officer that it is unable to make such arrangements.

Subsection.Text: The commercial transporter must carry the foreign national from Canada within 48 hours after giving the notice required by paragraph (2)(a).

If a commercial transporter does not comply with paragraph 2(a) or subsection (3) or notifies an officer that it is unable to comply with those provisions, or if an officer notifies the commercial transporter in writing that the proposed arrangements are not acceptable, an officer must cause the foreign national to be carried from Canada and the commercial transporter must pay the costs referred to in section 278.
To be acceptable, the arrangements referred to in subsection (2) must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the itinerary must begin where the foreign national is situated in Canada and end in the country and city to which the foreign national is to be removed, following the most direct routing possible;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the itinerary must not include a country through which transit has not been approved; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the period of time between any connections must not exceed 12 hours.

Subsection.Text: A commercial transporter that has been notified under paragraph 1(b) must comply with any request by an officer to provide an escort or to arrange for the carriage of the escort assigned by the Minister.

Section.Text: Despite sections 273 and 276, a commercial transporter is relieved of its obligation to carry a foreign national from Canada, except for a member of its crew or a foreign national who entered Canada to become a member of its crew, if the foreign national at the time of their examination

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was authorized to enter and remain in Canada on a temporary basis;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: held a temporary or permanent resident visa; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: was a person prescribed under section 258.1 and the commercial transporter was not, before the person was carried to Canada, notified under section 270 that the person may have been a prescribed person.

Section.Text: A transporter that is required under the Act to carry a foreign national from Canada must pay the following costs of removal and, if applicable, attempted removal:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: expenses incurred within or outside Canada with respect to the foreign national’s accommodation and transport, including penalties for changes of date or routing;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: accommodation and travel expenses incurred by any escorts provided to accompany the foreign national;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fees paid in obtaining passports, travel documents and visas for the foreign national and any escorts;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the cost of meals, incidentals and other expenses as calculated in accordance with the rates set out in the Travel Directive published by the Treasury Board Secretariat, as amended from time to time;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any wages paid to escorts and other personnel; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the costs or expenses incurred with respect to interpreters and medical and other personnel engaged for the removal.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), an administration fee must be assessed against a commercial transporter in respect of any of the following foreign nationals it carried or caused to be carried to Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who is inadmissible under section 41 of the Act for failing to meet the requirements of section 6, subsection 7(1), section 7.01 or 7.1 or subsection 50(1) or 52(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who is prescribed under section 258.1 or whom the commercial transporter has been directed under paragraph 148(1)(a) of the Act not to carry to Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who is exempt, under subsection 52(2), from the requirement to hold a passport or travel document but who fails to produce sufficient evidence of their identity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who failed to appear for an examination on entry into Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who entered Canada as a member of a crew or to become a member of a crew and is inadmissible; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who is subject to a removal order, or is allowed under section 42 to withdraw their application to enter Canada, and who fails to leave Canada immediately.

Subsection.Text: An administration fee shall not be assessed against a commercial transporter in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person referred to in section 39;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who is prescribed under section 258.1 and in respect of whom notice under section 270 was not given before the foreign national was carried to Canada but who holds the necessary documents prescribed under section 259;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who does not hold an electronic travel authorization when one is required under section 7.01 or 7.1 and in respect of whom the Canada Border Services Agency did not give notice under section 270 to the commercial transporter before the foreign national was carried to Canada, but who holds one of the required prescribed documents set out in paragraphs 259(a) to (f); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national, other than a foreign national referred to in paragraph 190(3)(c), who seeks to enter Canada to obtain permanent residence and is inadmissible under paragraph 41(a) of the Act for failing to obtain a permanent resident visa as required under section 6, but who is exempted under Division 1 of Part 2 from the requirement to obtain an electronic travel authorization required under section 7.01 or 7.1 or exempted under Division 5 of Part 9 from the requirement to obtain a temporary resident visa.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the administration fee assessed under section 279 is $3,200.
If a memorandum of understanding in accordance with subsection (3) is in effect between the commercial transporter and the Minister, the administration fee assessed is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $3,200, if the commercial transporter does not demonstrate that it complies with the memorandum of understanding, if the commercial transporter carried to Canada a foreign national who is prescribed under section 258.1 or whom the commercial transporter has been directed under paragraph 148(1)(a) of the Act not to carry to Canada, or if the administration fee is assessed in respect of a member of the crew of the transporter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $2,400, if the commercial transporter demonstrates that it complies with the memorandum of understanding;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: $1,600, if the commercial transporter demonstrates that it complies with the memorandum of understanding and has a number of administration fee assessments that is equal to or less than the number specified in the memorandum, for the period specified in the memorandum, for reducing the administration fee by 50%;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: $800, if the commercial transporter demonstrates that it complies with the memorandum of understanding and has a number of administration fee assessments that is equal to or less than the number specified in the memorandum, for the period specified in the memorandum, for reducing the administration fee by 75%; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: $0, if the commercial transporter demonstrates that it complies with the memorandum of understanding and has a number of administration fee assessments that is equal to or less than the number specified in the memorandum, for the period specified in the memorandum, for reducing the administration fee by 100%.

Subsection.Text: A memorandum of understanding referred to in subsection (2) shall include provisions respecting

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: document screening;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the training of personnel in document screening;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the use of technological aids;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: fraud prevention;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: gate checks;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: information exchange;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: performance standards and administration fee assessments;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: compliance monitoring of the provisions of the memorandum of understanding;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: holding documents under section 260;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: providing information referred to in subsections 269(1) and (2);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: stowaways; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: security screening of members of a crew.

Subsection.Text: The assessment of an administration fee shall be served personally, by registered mail, by facsimile with acknowledgement of receipt or by electronic transmission on a representative of the commercial transporter.
Service of the assessment by registered mail is deemed to have been effected on the seventh day after the day on which the assessment was mailed.
The commercial transporter may submit written submissions to the Minister within 30 days after being served with an assessment of an administration fee.
If submissions are made, the Minister must consider the submissions, confirm, vary or cancel the assessment and give written notice of the final decision to the commercial transporter.

In considering the submissions, the Minister must take into account whether the commercial transporter was, before the foreign national was carried to Canada, notified under section 270 that the foreign national may have been a person prescribed under section 258.1 or a person who did not hold an electronic travel authorization when one was required under section 7.01 or 7.1.
If no submissions are made within the 30-day period, the assessment is final and the commercial transporter is liable for the assessment at the end of that period.
If the Minister confirms an assessment under subsection (2), the commercial transporter is liable for the assessment on the date the notice is sent.
The Minister may, on the basis of the following factors, require a commercial transporter to provide security for compliance with its obligations under paragraphs 148(1)(a) to (g) of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the frequency and regularity of arrival, or anticipated arrival, of the transporter’s vehicles carrying persons to Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of persons carried, or anticipated to be carried, to Canada aboard the transporter’s vehicles;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whether the transporter has carried an inadmissible foreign national to Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the anticipated risk of inadmissible foreign nationals being carried to Canada by the transporter.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister requires security to be provided, the Minister shall determine the amount of security on the basis of the following factors:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the commercial transporter’s record of compliance with the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the anticipated risk of inadmissible foreign nationals being carried to Canada by the transporter and the estimated removal costs.

Subsection.Text: A commercial transporter who is required to provide security must provide it in the form of a cash deposit unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the transporter has entered into a memorandum of understanding referred to in subsection 280(2) that provides for another form of security; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transporter demonstrates that there is no significant risk of a debt not being paid if they were to provide another form of security.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister determines on the basis of the factors set out in subsection (1) that security is no longer required, the Minister shall return the security to the commercial transporter.

Section.MarginalNote: Application of s. 148(2) of the Act
Section.Text: For the purposes of subsection 148(2) of the Act, a prescribed good is a good that is not land, a building or a transportation facility.
If an object is detained or seized under subsection 148(2) of the Act, that object shall remain detained or seized until

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the transporter complies with its obligations under section 148 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transporter’s obligations are discharged by another person.

Subsection.Text: Following a seizure under subsection 148(2) of the Act, an officer shall make reasonable efforts to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: identify the lawful owner of the object seized; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: give notice of the seizure to that person.

Subsection.Text: A thing seized under subsection 148(2) of the Act shall be disposed of by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: returning the object to the transporter on receipt of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an amount equal to the value of the object at the time of seizure and any expenses incurred in the seizure and, if applicable, detention,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the security required under the Act or any costs and fees for which the transporter is liable, as well as an amount equal to any expenses incurred in the seizure and, if applicable, detention, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: evidence that the transporter is in compliance with its obligations under subsection 148(1) of the Act and has reimbursed Her Majesty in right of Canada for any expenses incurred in the seizure and, if applicable, detention; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: disposing of the object under section 287.

Subsection.Text: If a transporter does not comply with paragraph 286(2)(a) within a reasonable time, an officer shall give notice to the transporter that the object will be sold. The object shall then be sold for the benefit of Her Majesty in right of Canada and the proceeds of the sale shall be applied to the transporter’s outstanding debt to Her Majesty under the Act. Any surplus shall be returned to the transporter.

Any expenses incurred by Her Majesty in right of Canada in selling the object, and any expenses incurred in the seizure or, if applicable, detention of the object, shall be deducted from the proceeds of the sale.

Section.Text: In this Part, beneficiary, in respect of a person, means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a dependent child of the person or of the person’s spouse, common-law partner or conjugal partner; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other person who, at the time of their application for a permanent resident visa or their application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident, is in a relationship of dependency with the person by virtue of being cared for by or receiving emotional and financial support from the person.

Section.Text: The Minister may make loans to the following persons for the following purposes:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a foreign national referred to in Part 1 of the Act for the purpose of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: defraying the cost to the foreign national and their beneficiaries of transportation from their point of departure outside Canada to their point of destination in Canada, and related administrative charges,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: assisting the foreign national and their beneficiaries to become established in Canada, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: defraying the fee, referred to in subsection 303(1), payable for the acquisition by the foreign national and their beneficiaries of permanent resident status;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to a foreign national referred to in Part 2 of the Act for the purpose of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: defraying the cost to the foreign national and their beneficiaries of transportation from their point of departure outside Canada to their point of destination in Canada, and related administrative charges,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: defraying the cost to the foreign national and their beneficiaries of transportation to attend any interview relating to their application, and related administrative charges,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: defraying the cost to the foreign national and their beneficiaries of a medical examination under paragraph 16(2)(b) of the Act, and related costs and administrative charges, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: assisting the foreign national and their beneficiaries to become established in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to a permanent resident or a Canadian citizen for the purpose of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: defraying the cost to their beneficiaries of transportation from their point of departure outside Canada to their point of destination in Canada, and related administrative charges,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: defraying the cost to their beneficiaries of a medical examination under paragraph 16(2)(b) of the Act, and related costs and administrative charges, if the beneficiaries are protected persons within the meaning of subsection 95(2) of the Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: defraying the fee, referred to in subsection 303(1), payable for the acquisition by their beneficiaries of permanent resident status.

Subsection.Text: The maximum amount of advances that may be made under subsection 88(1) of the Act is $126,600,000.
The total amount of all loans made under this Part plus accrued interest on those loans shall not at any time exceed the maximum amount of advances prescribed by subsection (1).
Subject to section 292, a loan made under section 289 becomes payable

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a loan for the purpose of defraying transportation costs, one year after the day on which the person for whose benefit the loan was made enters Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a loan for any other purpose, one year after the day on which the loan was made.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 292, a loan made under section 289, together with all accrued interest, if applicable, must be repaid in full, in consecutive monthly instalments, within

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 36 months after the day on which the loan becomes payable, if the amount of the loan is not more than $1,200;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 48 months after the day on which the loan becomes payable, if the amount of the loan is more than $1,200 but not more than $2,400;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 60 months after the day on which the loan becomes payable, if the amount of the loan is more than $2,400 but not more than $3,600;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 72 months after the day on which the loan becomes payable, if the amount of the loan is more than $3,600 but not more than $4,800; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 96 months after the day on which the loan becomes payable, if the amount of the loan is more than $4,800.

Subsection.Text: If repaying a loan, in accordance with the requirements of section 291, that was made to a person under section 289 would, by reason of the person’s income, assets and liabilities, cause the person financial hardship, an officer may, to the extent necessary to relieve that hardship but subject to subsection (2), defer the commencement of the repayment of the loan, defer payments on the loan, vary the amount of the payments or extend the repayment period.
A repayment period shall not be extended beyond

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an additional 24 months, in the case of a loan referred to in paragraph 289(b); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an additional six months, in the case of any other loan.

Subsection.Text: A loan made under this Part bears no interest as of the day on which this section comes into force.
The interest on any loan that has not been repaid before that day continues to accrue until the day preceding that day.

Section.Text: In this Part,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a fee payable under this Part is payable not per application but for each person in respect of whom an application is made;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsections 295(3), 301(2), 304(2) and 314(3), a fee payable under this Part for processing an application is payable at the time the application is made; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsections 295(4) and 301(3), if the requirement to pay a fee depends on a person’s age or the amount of a fee is calculated in accordance with their age, the age of the person shall be determined as of the day the application in respect of which the fee is payable is made.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 2
Heading.TitleText: Fees for Applications for Authorizations, Visas and Permits

Subsection.Text: A fee of $7 is payable for processing an application for an electronic travel authorization.

A person whose application for a work permit or study permit or for renewal of a work permit or study permit is considered, as the case may be, under subsection 12.04(5) or (6), to constitute an application for an electronic travel authorization is not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1).
The following fees are payable for processing an application for a permanent resident visa:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is made by a person as a member of the family class

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a principal applicant, other than a principal applicant referred to in subparagraph (ii), $475,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a principal applicant who is a foreign national referred to in any of paragraphs 117(1)(b), (f), (g) or (h), is less than 22 years of age and is not a spouse or common-law partner, $75,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a spouse or common-law partner, $550, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a dependent child, $150;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is made by a person as a member of the Quebec investor class, the Quebec entrepreneur class, the start-up business class, the self-employed persons class or the Quebec self-employed persons class

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a principal applicant, $1,050,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a spouse or common-law partner, $550, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a dependent child, $150; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is made by a person as a member of any other class or by a person referred to in section 71

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a principal applicant, $550,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a spouse or common-law partner, $550, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a dependent child, $150.

Subsection.Text: The following persons are not required to pay the fees referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who makes an application as a member of the Convention refugees abroad class and the family members included in the member’s application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who makes an application as a member of a humanitarian-protected persons abroad class and the family members included in the member’s application.

Subsection.Text: The following persons are not required to pay the fees referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person described in paragraph 85.1(2)(a) who makes an application as a member of the transitional federal skilled worker class for a permanent resident visa and the family members included in the member’s application who were also included in the application referred to in subsection 85.1(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person described in paragraph 85.1(2)(b) who makes an application as a member of the transitional federal skilled worker class for a permanent resident visa and the family members included in the member’s application who were also included in the application referred to in subsection 85.1(2), if the fees for processing their withdrawn application have not been refunded.

Subsection.Text: A fee payable under subsection (1) in respect of a person who makes an application as a member of the family class or their family members

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is payable, together with the fee payable under subsection 304(1), at the time the sponsor files the sponsorship application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be repaid in accordance with regulations referred to in subsection 20(2) of the Financial Administration Act if, before the processing of the application for a permanent resident visa has begun, the sponsorship application is withdrawn by the sponsor.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(a), the age of the person in respect of whom the application is made shall be determined as of the day the sponsorship application is filed.
A fee of $100 is payable for processing an application for a temporary resident visa to enter Canada one or more times.
The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a properly accredited diplomat, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies or of any intergovernmental organization of which Canada is a member, the members of the suite of such a person and the family members of such a person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, including a person who has been designated as a civilian component of that visiting force under paragraph 4(c) of that Act, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of the clergy, a member of a religious order or a lay person who is to assist a congregation or a group in the achievement of its spiritual goals, if the duties to be performed by the person are to consist mainly of preaching doctrine, presiding at liturgical functions or spiritual counselling, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: persons, other than a group of performing artists and their staff, who apply at the same time and place for a work permit or a study permit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is seeking to enter Canada

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting hosted by the Government of Canada, an organization of the United Nations or the Organization of American States, as a participant,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting as a representative of the Organization of American States or the Caribbean Development Bank, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting hosted by the Government of Canada, an organization of the United Nations or the Organization of American States, at the invitation of the Government of Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is seeking to enter Canada as a competitor, coach, judge, team official, medical staff member or member of a national or international sports organizing body participating in the Pan-American Games, when held in Canada, or as a performer participating in a festival associated with any of those Games; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is seeking to enter Canada for a period of less than 48 hours and who is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: travelling by transporter’s vehicle to a destination other than Canada, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: transiting through or stopping over in Canada for refuelling or for the continuation of their journey in another transporter’s vehicle.

Subsection.Text: The total amount of fees payable under subsection (1) by an applicant and their family members who apply at the same time and place shall not exceed $500.
A fee of $200 is payable for processing an application for a temporary resident permit.
The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person referred to in subsection 295(2) or any of paragraphs 296(2)(c) and (d), 299(2)(a), (b), (d) to (f) and (h) to (k) and 300(2)(f) to (i);

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a properly accredited diplomat, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies or of any intergovernmental organization of which Canada is a member, the members of the suite of such a person and the family members of such a person;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, including a person who has been designated as a civilian component of that visiting force under paragraph 4(c) of that Act, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (a.3)
Paragraph.Text: a person whose work in Canada would create or maintain reciprocal employment for Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada in other countries and who is a family member of a person referred to in subparagraph 299(2)(g)(iii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person in respect of whom an application for a permanent resident visa, an application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident, or an application under subsection 25(1) of the Act is pending, or in respect of whom a decision under subsection 25.1(1) or 25.2(1) of the Act is pending;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a citizen of Costa Rica seeking to enter and remain in Canada during the period beginning on May 11, 2004 and ending on May 12, 2004, if the person does not hold a temporary resident visa but is not otherwise inadmissible;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is seeking to enter Canada

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting hosted by the Government of Canada, an organization of the United Nations or the Organization of American States, as a participant,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting as a representative of the Organization of American States or the Caribbean Development Bank, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting hosted by the Government of Canada, an organization of the United Nations or the Organization of American States, at the invitation of the Government of Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person who, while they are in transit to Canada, ceases to be exempt under paragraph 190(1)(a) from the requirement for a temporary resident visa, if, during the first 48 hours after they cease to be exempt from that requirement, they seek to enter and remain in Canada and are inadmissible to Canada for the sole reason that they do not have a temporary resident visa.

Subsection.Text: A fee of $155 is payable for processing an application for a work permit.
The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person in Canada who has made a refugee claim that has not yet been determined by the Refugee Protection Division, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person in Canada on whom refugee protection has been conferred, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of the Convention refugees abroad class or a member of a humanitarian-protected persons abroad class, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person who holds a study permit and is temporarily destitute, as described in paragraph 208(a);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person whose work in Canada is designated under subparagraph 205(c)(i);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a person who works in Canada for a Canadian religious or charitable organization, without remuneration;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a person whose work in Canada would create or maintain reciprocal employment for Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada in other countries and who is a family member of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a properly accredited diplomat, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies or of any intergovernmental organization of which Canada is a member,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, including a person who has been designated as a civilian component of that visiting force under paragraph 4(c) of that Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an officer of a foreign government sent, under an exchange agreement between Canada and one or more countries, to take up duties with a federal or provincial agency;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a person who works in Canada under an agreement entered into with a country by Canada or by or on behalf of a province, that provides for reciprocal employment opportunities of an artistic, cultural or educational nature;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a person whose work in Canada is pursuant to an international student or young workers reciprocal employment program;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a person who works in Canada as an officer of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service or of United States Customs carrying out pre-inspection duties, as an American member of the International Joint Commission or as a United States grain inspector, and their family members; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a United States Government official in possession of an official United States passport who is assigned to a temporary posting in Canada, and their family members.

Subsection.Text: The total amount of fees payable under subsection (1) by a group of three or more persons, consisting of performing artists and their staff, who apply at the same time and place for a work permit is $465.
A fee of $150 is payable for processing an application for a study permit.
The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person in Canada who has made a refugee claim that has not yet been determined by the Refugee Protection Division, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person in Canada on whom refugee protection has been conferred, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of the Convention refugees abroad class or a humanitarian-protected persons abroad class, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a properly accredited diplomat, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies or of any intergovernmental organization of which Canada is a member, the members of the suite of such a person and the family members of such a person;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, including a person who has been designated as a civilian component of that visiting force under paragraph 4(c) of that Act, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a person who holds a study permit and is temporarily destitute, as described in paragraph 208(a);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a person whose study in Canada is under an agreement or arrangement between Canada and another country that provides for reciprocity of student exchange programs;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a person who works in Canada as an officer of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service or of United States Customs carrying out pre-inspection duties, as an American member of the International Joint Commission or as a United States grain inspector, and their family members; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a United States Government official in possession of an official United States passport who is assigned to a temporary posting in Canada, and their family members.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 3
Heading.TitleText: Fees for Applications to Remain in Canada as a Permanent Resident

Subsection.Text: The following fees are payable for processing an application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is made by a person as a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a principal applicant, $475,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a spouse or common-law partner, $550, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a dependent child, $150; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is made by a person as a protected person referred to in subsection 21(2) of the Act

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a principal applicant, $550,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a spouse or common-law partner, $550, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in respect of a family member of the principal applicant who is a dependent child, $150.

Subsection.Text: A person who is a member of the protected temporary residents class and the family members included in their application are not required to pay the fees referred to in subsection (1).
The fee payable under subsection (1) in respect of a person who makes an application as a member of the spouse or common-law partner in Canada class or their family members

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is payable, together with the fee payable under subsection 304(1), at the time the sponsor files the sponsorship application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be repaid in accordance with regulations referred to in subsection 20(2) of the Financial Administration Act if, before the processing of the application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident has begun, the sponsorship application is withdrawn by the sponsor.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(a), the age of the person in respect of whom the application is made shall be determined as of the day the sponsorship application is filed.

Section.Text: A fee of $325 is payable for processing an application by a person as a member of the permit holder class to remain in Canada as a permanent resident.

Subsection.Text: A fee of $490 is payable by a person for the acquisition of permanent resident status.
The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a family member of a principal applicant and is a dependent child referred to in paragraph (b) or (c) of the definition family member in subsection 1(3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a principal applicant who is a foreign national referred to in paragraph 117(1)(b), (f) or (g);

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: a principal applicant in Canada who has made an application in accordance with section 66 and is a dependent child of a permanent resident or of a Canadian citizen;

Paragraph.Label: (b.2)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the permit holder class who is a dependent child of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a member of the permit holder class who has made an application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a permanent resident or a Canadian citizen;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a protected person within the meaning of subsection 95(2) of the Act who has applied to remain in Canada as a permanent resident, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of the protected temporary residents class and is described in paragraph 151.1(2)(b) and the family members included in their application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of the Convention refugees abroad class, and the family members included in their application; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of a humanitarian-protected persons abroad class, and the family members included in their application.

Subsection.Text: The fee referred to in subsection (1) is payable

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application by or on behalf of a person for a permanent resident visa, before the visa is issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application by or on behalf of a foreign national to remain in Canada as a permanent resident, before the foreign national becomes a permanent resident.

Subsection.Text: The fee referred to in subsection (1) is remitted if the person does not acquire permanent resident status, in which case the fee shall be repaid by the Minister to the person who paid it.

For the purpose of subsection (4), if the fee was paid before the day on which this subsection comes into force, the amount to be remitted and repaid — except to the extent otherwise remitted — is $975.

Despite subsections (4) and (5), in the case where the fee of $975 was paid in accordance with paragraph (3)(a), a portion of that fee in the amount of $485 is remitted and shall be repaid — except to the extent otherwise remitted — by the Minister to the person who paid the fee if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person in respect of whom the fee was paid has, on or before the day on which this subsection comes into force, not yet acquired permanent resident status and they are a person referred to in any of paragraphs 117(1)(a), (c), (d) or (h); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person in respect of whom the fee was paid acquires permanent resident status on or after the day on which this subsection comes into force and they are not a person referred to in any of paragraphs 117(1)(a), (c), (d) or (h).

Heading.Label: DIVISION 4.1
Heading.TitleText: Other Fees in Respect of Work Permits

Subsection.Text: A fee of $230 is payable by an employer who has made an offer of employment to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national in respect of work described in section 204 or 205;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national described in section 207; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) who makes an application for renewal of a work permit.

Subsection.Text: The fee referred to in subsection (1) is payable by means of the electronic system that is made available by the Department for that purpose, before the foreign national to whom the offer of employment is made makes an application for a work permit or an application for renewal of the work permit.
The fee is deemed to be paid on the date and at the time recorded in the electronic system.

If an employer is unable to pay the fee by means of the electronic system because of a physical or mental disability, the payment may be made by another means that is made available by the Department for that purpose and that would enable the employer to pay the fee.
An employer who is exempt from the application of sections 209.11 and 209.2 under section 209.91 is not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1).

An employer is not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1) if the offer of employment is made to a foreign national — other than a person referred to in paragraph 299(2)(i) — who under subsection 299(2) is not required to pay a fee for processing an application for a work permit.
The fee referred to in subsection (1) is remitted, and must be repaid by the Minister to the person who paid it, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the work permit is refused; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the employer withdraws the offer of employment and requests a remission before the work permit is issued.

Subsection.Text: The total amount of fees payable under subsection (1) by an employer who has made offers of employment to a group of three or more foreign nationals, consisting of performing artists and their staff, is $690, if those offers are made at the same time.
A fee of $100 is payable by a person for the rights and privileges conferred by means of a work permit if that person is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national who intends to perform work described in section 204 or 205 but does not have an offer of employment to perform that work;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign national described in paragraph 207(b) who does not have an offer of employment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of a foreign national referred to in paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person — other than a person referred to in paragraph 299(2)(i) — who under subsection 299(2) is not required to pay a fee for processing an application for a work permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person referred to in paragraph 299(2)(i) who intends to perform work under an international agreement between Canada and one or more countries, if the agreement

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: prohibits the payment of a fee other than a participation fee, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is in force at the time that the person makes an application for a work permit or for renewal of the work permit; and

Subsection.Text: The fee referred to in subsection (1) is remitted, and must be repaid by the Minister to the person who paid it, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the work permit is refused; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign national withdraws their application and requests a remission before the work permit is issued.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 5
Heading.TitleText: Fees for Other Applications and Services

Subsection.Text: A fee of $75 is payable for processing a sponsorship application under Part 7.
The fee referred to in subsection (1) is payable at the time the application is filed.

Heading.TitleText: Extension of Authorization to Remain in Canada as a Temporary Resident

Subsection.Text: A fee of $100 is payable for processing an application under subsection 181(1).
The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who makes an application for a work permit or a study permit at the same time as they make the application referred to in subsection (1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has made a claim for refugee protection that has not yet been determined by the Refugee Protection Division;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person on whom refugee protection has been conferred;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of the Convention refugees abroad class or a humanitarian-protected persons abroad class;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a properly accredited diplomat, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies or of any intergovernmental organization of which Canada is a member, the members of the suite of such a person and the family members of such a person;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, including a person who has been designated as a civilian component of that visiting force under paragraph 4(c) of that Act, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of the clergy, a member of a religious order or a lay person who is to assist a congregation or a group in the achievement of its spiritual goals, if the duties to be performed by the person are to consist mainly of preaching doctrine, presiding at liturgical functions or spiritual counselling, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: an officer of a foreign government sent, under an exchange agreement between Canada and one or more countries, to take up duties with a federal or provincial agency; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of any of the following persons, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person who holds a study permit and is temporarily destitute, as described in paragraph 208(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person whose work is designated under subparagraph 205(c)(i),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person whose work in Canada is for a Canadian religious or charitable organization, without remuneration,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a person whose presence in Canada is as a participant in a program sponsored by the Canadian International Development Agency, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a person whose presence in Canada is as a recipient of a Government of Canada scholarship or fellowship.

Subsection.Text: A fee of $200 is payable for processing an application under section 182.
A person who holds an unexpired temporary resident permit is not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1).

Heading.TitleText: Fees for a Request under Section 25 of the Act or an Examination of Circumstances under Section 25.2 of the Act

Section.Text: The following fees are payable for processing an application made in accordance with section 66 or for examining the circumstances under subsection 25.2(1) of the Act of a foreign national who applies for permanent resident status or for a permanent resident visa, if no fees are payable in respect of the same applicant for processing an application to remain in Canada as a permanent resident or an application for a permanent resident visa:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a principal applicant, $550;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a family member of the principal applicant who is a spouse or common-law partner, $550; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a family member of the principal applicant who is a dependent child, $150.

Subsection.Text: A fee of $50 is payable for processing an application made under paragraph 53(1)(b) for a permanent resident card.
A fee of $50 is payable for processing an application for the renewal of a permanent resident card or for the replacement of a lost, stolen or destroyed permanent resident card.
No fee is payable for the replacement of a permanent resident card containing an error that is not attributable to the permanent resident.

Section.Text: The following fees are payable for processing an application for a determination of rehabilitation under paragraph 36(3)(c) of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national inadmissible on grounds of serious criminality under paragraph 36(1)(b) or (c) of the Act, $1,000; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a foreign national inadmissible on grounds of criminality under paragraph 36(2)(b) or (c) of the Act, $200.

Section.Text: A fee of $400 is payable for processing an application for authorization to return to Canada under subsection 52(1) of the Act.

Heading.TitleText: Certification and Replacement of Immigration Document

Subsection.Text: A fee of $30 is payable for processing an application for the certification of an immigration document, other than a permanent resident card, confirming the date on which a person became a permanent resident.
A fee of $30 is payable for processing an application to replace any immigration document, other than a permanent resident card, that is issued by the Department.
The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a federal, provincial or municipal government agency;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person in receipt of provincial social assistance payments; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person in receipt of assistance under the Resettlement Assistance Program.

Subsection.Text: The following fees are payable for an examination for the purpose of entering Canada that is made outside the applicable service hours of the port of entry where the officer who conducts the examination is based:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a fee of $100 for the first four hours of examination; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a fee of $30 for each additional hour or part of an hour of examination.

Subsection.Text: The fees are payable at the time of the examination

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the transporter’s vehicle carrying the person to be examined arrives unscheduled at a port of entry outside service hours, by the transporter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, by the person who requests that the examination take place outside service hours.

Subsection.Text: A fee of $30 is payable for processing an application to enroll in a program for an alternative means of examination that is administered solely by the Minister.
The fee is payable in respect of each person to be examined by an alternative means referred to in subsection (1).
The following fees are payable for processing an application for immigration statistical data that have not been published by the Department:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $100 for the first 10 minutes or less of access to the Department’s database in order to respond to such an application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $30 for each additional minute or less of such access.

Subsection.Text: The following persons are not required to pay the fees referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an employee of the Department; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an employee of the Data Development Division of the Department of Employment and Social Development.

Subsection.Text: The fee referred to in subsection (1)(b) is payable at the time the service is rendered.

Section.Text: A fee of $50 is payable for processing an application for a travel document issued under subsection 31(3) of the Act.

Heading.TitleText: Services in Relation to the Collection, Use and Disclosure of Biometric Information

Subsection.Text: A fee of $85 is payable for the provision of services in relation to the collection of biometric information under Division 2.1 of Part 1 in respect of an application for a temporary resident visa, a study permit or a work permit and to the use and disclosure of that information and for the provision of services related to those services.
The following persons are not required to pay the fee referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a properly accredited diplomat, consular officer, representative or official of a country other than Canada, of the United Nations or any of its agencies or of any intergovernmental organization of which Canada is a member, the members of the suite of such a person and the family members of such a person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the armed forces of a country that is a designated state for the purposes of the Visiting Forces Act, including a person who has been designated as a civilian component of that visiting force under paragraph 4(c) of that Act, and their family members;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is seeking to enter Canada

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting hosted by the Government of Canada, an organization of the United Nations or the Organization of American States, as a participant,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting as a representative of the Organization of American States or the Caribbean Development Bank, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the purpose of attending a meeting hosted by the Government of Canada, an organization of the United Nations or the Organization of American States, at the invitation of the Government of Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is seeking to enter Canada as a competitor, coach, judge, team official, medical staff member or member of a national or international sports organizing body participating in the Pan-American Games, when held in Canada, or as a performer participating in a festival associated with any of those Games;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is seeking to enter Canada for a period of less than 48 hours and is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: travelling by transporter’s vehicle to a destination other than Canada, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: transiting through or stopping over in Canada for refuelling or for the continuation of their journey in another transporter’s vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is an application for a study permit or a work permit,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the family members of a person in Canada who has made a refugee claim that has not yet been determined by the Refugee Protection Division,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the family members of a person in Canada on whom refugee protection has been conferred, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the family members of a person who is a member of the Convention refugees abroad class or a member of a humanitarian-protected persons abroad class; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a person whose work in Canada would create or maintain reciprocal employment for Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada in other countries and who is a family member of an officer of a foreign government sent, under an exchange agreement between Canada and one or more countries, to take up duties with a federal or provincial agency.

Subsection.Text: The total amount of fees payable under subsection (1) is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to an application for a temporary resident visa, $170, if the applicant and their family members submit their application at the same time and place; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to an application for a work permit, $255, if the applicants are a group of three or more persons, consisting of performing artists and their staff, who submit their applications at the same time and place.

Heading.TitleText: Services in Relation to an Assessment from the Department of Employment and Social Development

Subsection.Text: A fee of $1,000 is payable for the provision of services in relation to an assessment from the Department of Employment and Social Development that is requested by an employer or group of employers under subsection 203(2) for each offer of employment in respect of which the request is made.
The fee must be paid at the time the request is made.
No fee is payable if the request is made in respect of an offer of employment that relates to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: work to be performed under an international agreement between Canada and one or more countries concerning seasonal agricultural workers; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any other work in the primary agriculture sector.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (3)(b), work in the primary agriculture sector means, subject to subsection (5), work that is performed within the boundaries of a farm, nursery or greenhouse and involves

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the operation of agricultural machinery;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the boarding, care, breeding, sanitation or other handling of animals, other than fish, for the purpose of obtaining animal products for market, or activities relating to the collection, handling and assessment of those products; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the planting, care, harvesting or preparation of crops, trees, sod or other plants for market.

Subsection.Text: Work in the primary agriculture sector does not include work involving

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the activities of agronomists or agricultural economists;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: landscape architecture;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the preparation of vegetable fibres for textile use;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: activities related to commercial hunting and trapping; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: veterinary activities.

Subsection.Text: No fee is payable if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the request is made in respect of an offer of employment that relates to work performed in a private household providing care to a person who is incapable of caring for themselves without assistance due to a physical or mental condition and who has a medical certificate from a medical practitioner entitled to practice medicine under the laws of a province, attesting to their incapacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
